101010001.Text: Has anyone seen the elderly Wen Tianweng?

101010002.Text: Maybe he was captured by monsters of the Legion?

101010003.Text: Trust me, Arlan, no one would want to kidnap a grumpy old man. {NICKNAME}, have you seen him?

101010005.Text: It is possible that someone might want to kidnap a grumpy old man...

101010006.Text: In any case, it'd be greatly appreciated if you could keep us posted. The old man might have gone traveling among the stars with friends from his younger days.

101020001.Text: Reports from the Curio Collection Squad on the frontline state that a type of Curio called a Xenohydro has been spotted in the space station

101020002.Text: Mingde hereby issues a wanted notice to all Herta researchers and partners: If you have any information regarding the Xenohydro, please immediately come forward and report it to the reception hall

101020003.Text: A sizable bounty is on offer!

101020007.Text: A massive influx of information is coming in all at once... and yet not even a single relevant clue has been found to lead to anything...

101020008.Text: Patience, everyone. Listen to me: Carry on with your search, and go to the reception hall if you have something to discuss

101030001.Text: Waaaah, can someone please help me... It's urgent. I need a reply asap

101030002.Text: What happened? The Security Department is about to be in position.

101030003.Text: Darn. Did you hit the "Send all" button?

101030004.Text: Abraham... He's terrified by every little thing out there. The squad has helped him so many times before. He is probably making a big deal out of nothing again

101030006.Text: In the reception hall, where I was working on Project Revival, I ran across this insurmountable obstacle. *sigh*... I'm sure Alfred would have come to my rescue if he were still around

101030007.Text: What choice do I have? I'm not one to watch from the sideline

101030009.Text: When did I get so many friends?

101030011.Text: That's right, Abraham. Pull yourself together. Moping like this won't protect people or avenge your friends.

101030012.Text: Haha, a technical issue such as your friend list is no problem for my researchers

101030013.Text: So sorry if my researchers inconvenienced you in any way. I've already taken it on myself to block the rest of your admirers who are still queuing to add you to their friend list

101030014.Text: As for all those requests already received, it's up to you to decide what to do with them.

When did I get so many friends?

101040005.Text: Oh sorry, but whoever is reading this, please tell Ley when you meet her that Rocky will be waiting for her at the space station

101050001.Text: Might I take a moment of your time, {NICKNAME}? Any chance you are familiar with classical poems?

101050002.Text: Ahem, I don't usually speak like this. Must have read too much poetry recently

101050003.Text: I got an encrypted letter. It must be really good, because I can't understand a single word

101050004.Text: You seem pretty smart, so please come back and help me out with this one as soon as you have time. Otherwise, sooner or later, I'll just die from the curiosity alone

101060001.Text: It's not scary to know there are people better than you. What's scary is that they even work harder than you!

101060002.Text: Youngster, how can you even sleep at night while knowing that other people are doing so much better than you!?

101060003.Text: The world has no magical conch shells, nor does it rain credits. You are not the chosen one, so if you want something, work hard for it!

101060004.Text: I'm offended. You think you're funny?

101060005.Text: What's this spam? Does my phone have a virus...

101060006.Text: I'm curious. Are you related to the magic conch?

101060007.Text: This is a kind reminder from the Security Center: Please stay alert to anonymous messages sent from unknown sources and exercise extreme caution when reading any such information, as it may be fraudulent. If you need help, don't hesitate to reach out to the space station's Security Department. (Sent to all, please don't reply)

101060009.Text: "Please don't reply"? Oh, I am definitely replying!!!

She insists that the footage contains sensitive material and refuses to let the Security Department get involved to conduct any investigation

101070003.Text: You left a good impression on the old heads of the department and have quite a positive reputation among the elderly here. If you go to investigate, I'm sure the seniors will cooperate

101070004.Text: Sure. Caring for the elderly and the young is my passion

101070005.Text: How did I ever become the go-to {M#guy}{F#gal} for the elderly...

101070006.Text: Nice. I knew I could count on you. The old lady's name is Esther. You can find her in the master control zone. I'm right now busy taming this Wubbaboo at the moment. So, talk to you later!

101070009.Text: I won't go until you reply

101070011.Text: I'll get mad if you don't reply

101090000.Text: You Already Know Me invited Take-Ultimate-To-The-Face into the group chat and shared the last 10 messages.

101090004.Text: Think long and hard about it. With a space station this large, how much profit can one squeeze out?

101090005.Text: This is not something to joke about. She's Madam Herta's student

101090006.Text: What about it? So we are not allowed to talk about her just because she's Herta's student?

101090008.Text: There's a lot of juicy stuff about her

101090010.Text: It's a bit inconvenient right now

101090013.Text: Check out the group name yourself @Take-Ultimate-To-The-Face

101090015.Text: Do you even know the rules, newbie?

101090018.Text: Care to give me a recap?

101090022.Text: Stop baiting us. This is an anonymous chatroom, so no need to beat around the bush. Just spill it out already

101090023.Text: It's not like you guys don't already know...

101090025.Text: You know, that whole embezzling thing

101090026.Text: Did you see the huge piles of parcels at the reception hall? All of them are addressed to our young lead researcher!

101090027.Text: Goodness gracious! So this is where all the money has gone this whole time. No wonder the budget's been so tight.

101090028.Text: Just hold your horses! Let's not rush to throw accusations around yet

101090029.Text: We can't just rely on your words. Where's the evidence?

101090030.Text: Evidence? Did you see the huge piles of parcels at the reception hall? All of them are addressed to our young lead researcher!

101090032.Text: I only took a glimpse at them, and they're all super expensive.

101090033.Text: And she bought them in her own name?

101090034.Text: How else? If she bought them under the space station's name, she'd have to declare it on the record. Surely, our lead researcher is not that careless?

101090035.Text: Maybe she paid for them herself?

101090036.Text: Other than Madam Herta, who on earth can afford those things with their own money?

101090037.Text: You guys know that Arlan from the Security Department? I saw him acting all weird and suspicious at the front desk. If it weren't for the guilty look on his face, I could have never noticed.

101090038.Text: Hmm, since you brought it up... I might have also seen Arlan acting weird when receiving some packages.

101090042.Text: Are you suggesting Asta and Arlan are in cahoots to secretively enrich themselves?

101090043.Text: I dunno. @Richard_Knowitall said it, not me

101090044.Text: That's just all in your head, there's no solid evidence...

101090046.Text: LOL! Come on. No way of spinning this one. It's practically an open secret that Arlan was a crony brought in by that little Asta girl.

101090047.Text: That's quite a claim... You sure this is something that I can just listen to for free?

101090048.Text: I hereby do declare that I have nothing to do with the aforementioned information!

101090049.Text: I hereby do declare that I have nothing to do with the aforementioned information!

101090050.Text: I voluntarily obey any arrangements and instructions from Madam Herta!

101090051.Text: ...Ah, tsk. I was waiting a good part of the day for some juicy gossip. Is that it?

101090052.Text: Exactly. When it's all said and done, there still isn't any hard proof

101090053.Text: @M-Robot But you just said it yourself that Arlan was acting all suspicious.

101090055.Text: I'm actually covertly investigating the source of her assets, but it isn't time to reveal everything yet.

101090056.Text: Just you wait. Within days, there will be a major story in the space station!

Choices.Text: Care to give me a recap?
And she bought them in her own name?
Asta is stuffing her own pockets?
A mere speculation without concrete evidence
This is truly some explosive stuff

101100000.Text: Remember to send me the pictures when you get them!

101100002.Text: Oh my, Himeko really is beautiful. Hohoho, I'm going to print this out as a wallpaper and hang it in my room so that I can look at it all day

101100003.Text: Right, I said I was going to give you Richard_Knowitall's identity, didn't I?

101100004.Text: He's Richard from the Department of Galactic Geopolitics. This information is guaranteed to be authentic. He's a business rival, after all

101100005.Text: So, his real name is actually Richard!?

101100006.Text: Yes, he's that tall and thin man with black-rimmed glasses and a slanted fringe

101100007.Text: Rivals have once again turned into nemeses!

101100008.Text: I told you so. Let me give you another hint for free: He's that tall and thin man with black-rimmed glasses and a slanted fringe

101100009.Text: This guy had just been chased out by his own department, so he's always hanging around at the reception hall

101100010.Text: That "inside scoop" that he has? I know all about it too. You want to hear about it? The same terms of our deal still apply, hehe, Himeko...

Choices.Text: So, his real name is actually Richard!?
Rivals have once again turned into nemeses!

101110000.Text: Thanks for your help in uncovering the conspirator, I would like to thank you on behalf of Asta. Leave the rest to me

101110001.Text: Herta didn't punish Asta, did she?

101110002.Text: You really don't understand Madam Herta, do you? She couldn't care less about trivial matters like this

101110003.Text: Is it true that Asta bought all those things with her own money?

101110005.Text: This space station may be Madam Herta's property, but she didn't pay a single credit for its construction

101110006.Text: Miss Asta's family has ties to the IPC, so saying she's... "wealthy" would be an understatement. Most of the facilities in the space station were essentially funded by her...

101110007.Text: So the cost of those things she purchased... was practically nothing for her, really

101110008.Text: What exactly is the Interastral Peace Corporation?

101110009.Text: Ahh... You can just think of them as the cosmos's wealthiest organization

101110010.Text: Is it too late to cozy up with Miss Asta now?

101110011.Text: ...Please don't joke about that. I'll take it seriously

101110013.Text: Have you decided on what to do with Richard?

101110014.Text: ...I don't think you want to know the details

101110015.Text: In any case, I have to thank you for helping Miss Asta with this incident

101120000.Text: The backend detected a weird quantum fluctuation just now. You were right beside it at the time. What happened?

101120001.Text: I just whacked the Curio a few times and the crack on it disappeared. I can't even believe it myself

101120002.Text: I just whacked the Curio a few times and the crack on it disappeared. I can't even believe it myself

101120004.Text: ...Is this what they call a "percussive maintenance?"

101120005.Text: The backend data from Panopticon System does show it has been fixed, and is activated at the moment. It's been giving out a steady energy reading

101120006.Text: It may be pure luck, but this is too much of a coincidence. Hey, could it be that your hand was blessed by an Aeon?

101120007.Text: ...Alright, I'm kidding. No matter how, you are the one who did it. I've sent you the reward. Remember to check it out

101130000.Text: {NICKNAME}, you said you're back at the space station?

101130001.Text: There's something that I can only talk to you about...

101130002.Text: If it's not too much trouble, could you come over for a chat?

101130003.Text: I have a bad feeling about this...

101130004.Text: No, no! It's not anything weird. I just need to discuss something with you in person

101130005.Text: Since it's just kinda embarrassing to talk about it over messaging

101130006.Text: No need to bother you. I'm headed back to the Express

101130007.Text: Hey, stop teasing! I really do have something urgent to talk about!

101130008.Text: I'll be waiting for you at the usual spot. Please hurry

No need to bother you. I'm headed back to the Express

101140000.Text: I see that {NICKNAME}'s coordinates are still at the space station. Maybe it'd be easier to chat in a group

101140001.Text: There's a batch of my old manuscripts in the space station. And you know how I've been writing a book for the IPC. So, I've been thinking... maybe how I could just copy and paste a few pages of my old manuscripts for the extra book content

101140002.Text: One of them is called decompression equation 36 or something. I can't remember the exact name. Anyway, that's the content. After you clean up the Antimatter Legion, help me find it and send it to the office

101140005.Text: Send it over then. Incidentally, I do have an experiment that could use some help from both of you

101090100.Text: Just came back from a nap. What's with 99+ new messages?

101090101.Text: And here I thought there was another incident in the space station

101090102.Text: This is how much freedom this group chatroom has.

101090103.Text: This is how free and unoccupied this group of chatters are.

101090104.Text: Differences in research capacities are no obstacles to communication. Everyone can express their childlike curiosity in any way they so desire.

101090105.Text: This is a new form of collision of ideas, a brave exploration of one's own work and life!

101090107.Text: That story about Lead Researcher Asta has begun to circulate

101090108.Text: There's a mole in this group chat

101090109.Text: LOL, which group chat doesn't have a mole?

101090110.Text: Come on. Does anyone in this group chat actually need to do any work? Are we even working for the same space station?

101090112.Text: It's none of your business if we just want to chat a little

101090113.Text: What I choose to say in this group is also none of your business

101090114.Text: Fine. You do you. You're the one with work ethics. I'm leaving.

101090202.Text: The Security Department locked down the area around the Special Purpose Lab. I heard there were remnants of the Legion!

101090203.Text: Not just that, the Fragmentum too

101090204.Text: Fragmentum? At the space station? Are you sure?

101090205.Text: I'm looking through the security tapes. It looks like the Fragmentum is a minor one. But there seem to be monsters there that can only come from the Fragmentum

101090206.Text: My goodness... I've only seen samples before, but never a real live Fragmentum

101090207.Text: I'll go take a peek then. See you guys later.

101090208.Text: Curiosity kills the cat. Someone like you wouldn't stay alive for more than 15 minutes in a movie

101090212.Text: Why don't you two just get married already?

101090300.Text: LOL! Some young brat just came up to me

101090302.Text: Rich, what about your scoop? Everyone wants to know when you're gonna reveal it!

101090303.Text: Soon, soon! Remember the youngster I just mentioned? That brat came up to me to ask about this too

101090304.Text: Once I showed my irrefutable evidence, even they have to shut up! Hahaha

101090306.Text: The one who came to find you was the person who fought off the Legion's Doomsday Beast

101090309.Text: I saw it on the monitors too. This person also defeated the Fragmentum monsters back at the Special Purpose Lab

101090311.Text: Oh dear, looks like you've run into a big shot, Rich

101090400.Text: [An Update on the Rumor Circulating in a Certain Anonymous Chat Group Regarding the Space Station's Lead Researcher] #LatestUpdate The rumor in circulation is false and untrue. Equipment purchase records and statement information have been properly disclosed to the relevant department in the IPC. The full reports of the investigation have been posted on the Space Station's Personnel Internal Data Center. With help offered by a certain volunteer, the said rumor has been determined to be false. The Space Station Security Center has dealt with the perpetrator of this false accusation in accordance with the regulations. Furthermore, we would also like to urge all employees to remain alert to any unverified rumors and refrain from spreading them further, so that we can together build a positive social environment within the space station

101090401.Text: Note: The procured little robot has been placed in the communal area. Please feel free to check it out

101090402.Text: What did I say? You tried to maliciously defame a little girl, and now you're not even going to apologize?

101090404.Text: Like something out of a horror story, Richard_Knowitall is nowhere to be found in the space station anymore

101090405.Text: Are you from the Security Department's monitoring room? You seem to have a lot of free time.

101090406.Text: Bill Portcullis left the group chat

101090407.Text: @M-Robot LOL. It's just plain funny to have someone like you lecture us when all you do is ride your moral high horse and hide behind anonymity

101090408.Text: If you're so good at being a keyboard warrior, why don't you show your staff card? Come on, let's take this offline!

101090409.Text: You're... so philistine, such an ignoramus!

101090411.Text: Hehehehe, I see right through you, whoever you are!

101090412.Text: Licenseless Space Driving was kicked from group

101090413.Text: Everyone, while chatting here, please mind your manners and watch your words. Don't offend people, don't make bad jokes, and don't provoke others! And also, don't stick your nose into other people's sensitive issues and don't try to get to the bottom of them.

101090414.Text: When chatting here, everyone must take extra effort to hurt people, make bad jokes, and provoke others! We must dig deeply into other peoples' sensitive issues to find out the truth

101090415.Text: We need to learn to be tolerant and considerate while communicating. If there is a difference in opinion, don't fight over it, and don't act on impulse!

101090416.Text: We need to learn to be ruthless and relentless while communicating. If there's a difference in opinion, do what your gut tells you. Never back off or back down, and never admit defeat.

101090419.Text: Viridian Malva Nut left the group

101090421.Text: Purple Shirley left the group chat.

101090422.Text: Umm... Looking at the chat history, all I see is just people fighting. Honestly, I'm not interested.

101090424.Text: Yeah, I'm leaving too, I can't take this

101090425.Text: *sigh* You guys... Forget it, I'm getting too old for this

101090427.Text: Peoplebreaker, Ginger Spotted Dove, Private Dating Chat, HairMaestro, and 66 others left the group chat.

101090428.Text: Whoa, I had no idea there were so many people in this group chat.

101090429.Text: I remember you. You added me to the group

101090430.Text: Yep. Come to think of it, I haven't formally thanked you for your help

101090431.Text: Was this all part of your plan?

101090432.Text: You give me too much credit. I just needed the help of the space station's big hero to settle some stuff that I couldn't attend to myself

101090436.Text: Madam Herta's Heritor Club has been disbanded by the owner

101190102.Text: Do you have some time? I still haven't thanked you for helping me when we first met

101190103.Text: First met... What do you mean?

101190104.Text: You found me wounded in the monitoring room and took me somewhere safe

101190105.Text: Thank you... If it weren't for you, I wouldn't have lasted much longer

101190106.Text: You're being too polite. It was nothing

101190107.Text: I wouldn't have lasted much longer if you hadn't found me

101190108.Text: Thank you for finding me in the monitoring room and taking me somewhere safe

101190109.Text: You should thank Dan Heng. He was the one who found you

101190110.Text: Both of you saved my life. I wouldn't have lasted much longer

101190111.Text: Thank you for finding me and taking me somewhere safe

101190112.Text: Do you have time to come to the base zone? I have a gift I want to give you

101190115.Text: A gift? Now I feel awkward

101190116.Text: Don't worry. It's not anything expensive

101190118.Text: Can you mail it to me?

101190119.Text: I want to give it to you face-to-face. That's more formal

Choices.Text: Shouldn't you be thanking Dan Heng?

101200000.Text: I met a mysterious big fellow, and I just ran for my life!

101200002.Text: I was just developing the photo of our research group from a few days ago. Everyone, come and have a look. I think something is in this photo!

101200004.Text: I was maintaining lab equipment routinely a few nights ago, but I walked into the scene of an assembly of strange creatures!

101210001.Text: Lots of little robots have recently disconnected from the terminal. My checks say they were manually turned off

101210002.Text: The Security Department tells me you went past that area. Did you see anyone suspicious?

101210003.Text: Um... I'll admit I did it. They were on standby, so I just tapped them a few times...

101210005.Text: Alright, don't do it again. I'll ignore it this time

101210006.Text: Um... I don't know. I just passed by and wasn't really looking

101210007.Text: Ahh, okay, I'll go check again. Thanks

101220101.Text: Hey friend! You're still at the space station, right? I wanna talk to you about something

101220102.Text: Yep, still here. What is it?

101220104.Text: Not at the space station anymore

101220105.Text: And I won't be coming back

101220108.Text: Why didn't you say this before?

101220109.Text: I didn't wanna say that with so many people around. My boss was there too

101220110.Text: It's been a while since that incident, but I'm still very worried about the space station's cybersecurity

101220111.Text: I wanna prepare while I can, and I've got an idea that I wanna run past you

101220112.Text: Let's talk about the details face to face. I'm outside the office

101220113.Text: Please make sure to drop by!

Choices.Text: Why didn't you say this before?

101230106.Text: Pom-Pom doesn't even want to think about it...

101230107.Text: The train's long overdue cleaning day is almost upon us! Aaaaahhh!

101230110.Text: So, you want me to come back and help you with the cleaning?

101230113.Text: But if you're willing to lend a hand, {NICKNAME}, that would be great!

101230114.Text: We're on our way to the nearest Washtopia.

101230115.Text: Come back and see me when you have time!

101240001.Text: {NICKNAME}, are you all safe and sound?

101240010.Text: I knew it. You're still alive!

101240011.Text: It's so good to see that you made it through!!!

101240012.Text: The moment a knight enters battle, they should already have full belief in their victory.

101240013.Text: When I fought against it, it was as if the light of Beauty protected me.

101240014.Text: Whatever happened next, alas, I do not recall.

101240015.Text: But the True Sting mayhaps have a case of... bad breath. Something akin to indigestion.

101240016.Text: Afterwards, I spent a long time wiping and polishing my armor

101240020.Text: Himeko even contacted the IPC to track you through the universe

101240022.Text: Pom-Pom will drive the Express over to pick you up!

101250001.Text: {NICKNAME}, how do you fare? Have you all reached Washtopia?

101250002.Text: Feeling pretty good. The Express is safely at the station now!

101250003.Text: We scrubbed the Express clean inside and out with the staff at Washtopia...

101250004.Text: It doesn't feel like we've gotten over it... but the Express is safely at the station already!

101250005.Text: We scrubbed the Express clean inside and out with the staff at Washtopia...

101250007.Text: {NICKNAME}, I have been hesitating about whether or not to tell you something.

101250008.Text: I am uncertain whether you have noticed this, but...

101250009.Text: There's a fourth bug in the Express.

101250010.Text: I didn't realize that at all!

101250011.Text: It's hiding inside Velite's armor, a mini insect. However, it was none other than the overlord they mentioned.

101250012.Text: The Giant Sting is at the bottom of the ladder to them

101250013.Text: But the overlord is small enough to hide inside Velite's armor

101250014.Text: It must have quite the temper, too

101250015.Text: The biggest is the least powerful...

101250016.Text: I thought that one was the overlord

101250017.Text: Maybe it looks super scary, too

101250018.Text: When I tracked down Velite, he said he saw himself flying, and steering the One and Only.

101250019.Text: I helped him to defeat the insect boss. However, he seemed a little lost after the illusion faded away.

101250020.Text: It's like when you see beautiful things

101250021.Text: And yet he says he has no obsessions and is immune to hallucinations

101250022.Text: I suspect he was quietly affected by you...

101250023.Text: I remembered he said he wanted to be a pilot

101250024.Text: And yet he says he has no obsessions and is immune to hallucinations

101250025.Text: I suspect he was quietly affected by you...

101250026.Text: He thought it over for a few days, but for some reason chose to give up this idea of using currency to spread Beauty... He seemed keen to become a pilot instead, and I showed him my support.

101250027.Text: However, regarding the basis of the hallucination... {NICKNAME}, I'm still confounded.

101250028.Text: According to you, the wing dust made everyone see the same fireworks at the end... Why?

101250029.Text: Heh, everyone longs to return to the stars. That thought's too strong

101250030.Text: It's also what everyone saw as a medal ceremony to you, Argenti!

Choices.Text: So the overlord is not the Giant Sting
Ha, the big guy is what rank?
I think he gave up being a pilot

104020001.Text: How's Marmoreal Market looking to you guys?

104020002.Text: We've wandered plenty. Run into lots of interesting people and things

104020003.Text: We've wandered plenty. Run into lots of interesting people and things

104020004.Text: That's nice! As long as you enjoyed yourself

104020005.Text: The baths have also returned to their original bustling state from before the war. Once you're done walking around, come find us back at Marmoreal Palace

104020006.Text: Aglaea's prepared a huge gift for you!

104030000.Text: Lady Aglaea, we have completed all preparations, and are ready to head to Castrum Kremnos' past to find a way to break through this deadlock.

104030001.Text: Thank you. I will also stabilize the political situation in the city and be prepared to support you from afar.

104030002.Text: There's no need to hold yourself back, Cas. Do what you want to do. We all trust you.

104040000.Text: It was as I said. The Rosy Celestial Maiden doesn't resemble someone from Amphoreus no matter what

104040001.Text: And there are so many wonders you won't see in Amphoreus in that photostone: A world of snow, countless small boats in the sky, splendorous skyscrapers...

104040002.Text: The "world beyond the sky" is real!

104040003.Text: Her hair was pink, and she wore a short blue blouse, and her eyes were as the sea reflecting the light of sunset...

104040004.Text: Is this seriously not Mnestia's human avatar?

104040006.Text: Nonsense! I already said that the Rosy Celestial Maiden isn't from Amphoreus! She's from beyond the sky!

104040007.Text: I'll admit that I've read a great many unofficial historical records, but the Skyship Calamity is not an apocryphal tale! It is a tragedy that really happened

104040008.Text: No one can pass the sky dome while Aquila maintains their baleful gaze... After all, it's questionable if any world beyond the sky even exists!

104040009.Text: Even the existence of the Rosy Celestial Maiden is in dispute

104040010.Text: I still have a few attires made by Lady Aglaea herself. I hope I can make the Rosy Celestial Maiden's acquaintance with these supreme garbs as a gift!

104040011.Text: I told you I saw it with my own eyes!

104040012.Text: Really? Then I saw Nikador and Kephale clasping hands in a gesture of peace with my own eyes!

104040013.Text: My dear explorer, you're speaking drivel. You must have been deceived by Zagreus

104040014.Text: I speak with honesty, and you treat me like this...? Fine. So be it. I'll prove the existence of the world beyond the sky through my own means!

104040015.Text: Just watch me! I will soar to the world beyond the sky

104040016.Text: Even if I have to risk my own life, I'll find the Rosy Celestial Maiden and silence you all!

107000000.Text:
(Advertisement) Do you have any plans for tonight, {NICKNAME}?
Your friend, Leonard Calliwell, is playing a heart-pumping space warfare game, Cosmic Warfare.
Do you want to face the emperor's mecha army in the Aurora Counter-Offensive Battle? Experience a day in a cloud-top mansion at Pier Point as a P35 staff member? Or do you want to turn into Galaxy Rangers with your friends and experience the epic assassination operation that shook the cosmos? Right now, the multiplayer online game Cosmic Warfare is open to all users. Meet up with Leonard Calliwell, and begin a cosmic journey of your own.
* Requires Interastral Network membership.

107010000.Text: (Advertisement) Congratulations! You have completed the High Score Challenge in Cosmic Warfare and obtained a stage victory. Please confirm your battle statistics in the monitoring room

107020000.Text: (Advertisement) Thank you for your support. The limited trial experience of Cosmic Warfare has ended, and the game application will be automatically uninstalled. Thank you for your support, and we hope to see you again

107030000.Text: RedBeanStan has invited Take-Ultimate-To-The-Face to the group chat.

107030001.Text: Hey, I've got some juicy gossip!

107030002.Text: The IPC is sending their guys to the space station!

107030006.Text: They just sneaked in without any notice

107030007.Text: I've got a hunch that IPC caught wind of the Genius Society big shots having a meeting, and now they're planning to work with them on the Simulated Universe project

107040001.Text: {NICKNAME}, thanks a bunch for supporting the AI Herta experiment!

107040002.Text: I've already transferred the experiment funds to you. Be sure to check your account.

107040003.Text: So the experiment is officially over? Are there any follow-up plans or other news?

107040004.Text: Madam Herta thought it was amusing but didn't provide any real breakthroughs, so she just had me delete everything.

107040005.Text: Wait, what experiment funds? Are you paying me out of your own pocket again?

107040007.Text: Here's a funny thing. Madam Herta mentioned that "My digital version thinks more highly of {NICKNAME} than I expected."

107040008.Text: That's precisely what the experiment was designed to test, whether a copy can match the original's judgment and intelligence.

107040009.Text: Based on our observations, AI Herta appears to be... more generous with compliments? Hard to say for sure. But... I suspect that might be why Madam Herta decided to pull the plug on the experiment.

111000000.Text: Outsider! I finally got your contact! I have something to tell you: Boss Scott has been talking every day about how we need to try some business models. He's quite worked up about this... If you have time, can you chat with him? I'm telling you, you can make a ton of money!

111000002.Text: Sure, I'll go see him now

111000003.Text: Who is Scott? Never heard of him

111000004.Text: Hello? Forgot about me already? Host of the Fight Club, Cold Dragon Young? Does that ring a bell?

111000005.Text: Ha, nice! I knew you were the right person to ask

111000006.Text: Hey, don't be like that. Boss Scott is the most powerful man in the Underworld. Loads of people want to be his friend

111000007.Text: Anyway, go talk to Boss Scott when you have time, I guarantee it's gonna be a good deal for you. Don't forget to patronize the club when you make your fortune!

Choices.Text: Sure, I'll go see him now
Who is Scott? Never heard of him

111010000.Text: (Promotion) Tomorrow, Wildfire will host an auction near the vagrant camp on the outskirts of the robot settlement. Everyone in the Underworld is invited. Buyers and Vendors, please register with your real name prior to the auction. If you want to know more, talk to our team members at the Boulder Town news office

111020000.Text: {NICKNAME}, my hero! I finally got a hold of you! You must save me!

111020002.Text: Sorry, your message could not be sent. Please try again later

111020003.Text: Please reply soon! I'm begging you. It's life and death!

111020004.Text: Could not be sent? Does this even work...?

111020005.Text: When you have a second, meet me at the Great Mine, my valuable patron! Every second matters. My life is in your hands now, friend

Choices.Text: Sorry, your message could not be sent. Please try again later

111030000.Text: 123 are you the honorary member of The Moles I am Pitch-Dark Hook the Great I borrowed Julian stuff to message you I'm not good at typing yet It's sooo difficult Right I need your help Come find me and don't you ever tell that old witch otherwise you are done for

111040000.Text: Urgent reports from the logistics team said a number of broken patrol robots from an unknown source were spotted in the restricted zone. They pose a risk to our staff members. Until the situation is resolved, non-combatants are advised not to operate alone and should apply for an escort team when the situation demands it. Anyone who has information on the origin of these robots should report to Molly, tier-2 engineer of the Technology Division

111050000.Text: Hey, {NICKNAME}! I just want to thank you for helping Molly out

111050001.Text: It's the least I could do

111050004.Text: Haha, well you just like helping everyone, don't you?

111050005.Text: Take the compliment, will you? Pela told me everything

111050006.Text: She's fine and in pretty good shape. Don't worry, I'll look after her

111050007.Text: Come down to the workshop if you can. Molly is not as grumpy as she seems. She actually wants company. And she'd be so happy if you could have a chat with her. That's all I wanted to say. See ya!

Choices.Text: It's the least I could do

111060000.Text: Hello? Hello? Anyone? How do I use this thing... "Send all"? What's that supposed to mean...

111060002.Text: Allow me to give you a tutorial on how to send money...

111060003.Text: This is the money transfer function. Please transfer 200 credits

111060004.Text: What? Someone actually replied? Are you a real person or a bot? Anyhow, listen, I'm Julian, the Chief Intelligence Officer of The Moles. I need some extra help right now. If you are free, come find me at the entrance of the Great Mine!

Choices.Text: Allow me to give you a tutorial on how to send money...
This is the money transfer function. Please transfer 200 credits

111070000.Text: {NICKNAME}, can you receive this message? March 7th gave me this little thing and taught me how to use it. Well, it seems you can teach an old dog new tricks after all. It just takes time. I kinda know how it works by now. Nice to have something that lets me talk to people without meeting them face to face. Haha.

111070003.Text: I'm flattered, {NICKNAME}. Now let's cut to the chase

111070004.Text: Hahaha, even you have started calling me that? Anyway, let's cut to the chase

111070005.Text: I heard Natasha is seeing a lot of patients and hasn't slept for days. She's the backbone of the Underworld, and we can't afford to have her burned out. {NICKNAME}, I know you did a great favor for her recently, but can I ask you to check on her again just to make sure she's alright?

111070006.Text: No problem. I'll go right away

111070007.Text: She's strong. She should be fine

111070008.Text: Haha, I knew I could count on you the first time we met. I was not wrong after all. Thank you so much

111070009.Text: Haha, I agree. She can be an overachiever. In any case, a little extra help is always welcome. Thank you in advance

Choices.Text: No problem. I'll go right away
She's strong. She should be fine

111080000.Text: Sorry to bother you, {NICKNAME}, I haven't quite got the hang of this little thing yet. Can you come down to the clinic when you have time? I have some personal things that I want to talk to you about

111080002.Text: Okay, just let me wrap up some other work first

111080003.Text: Thank you, {NICKNAME}. When you're leading an organization like Wildfire, it's easy to forget that everyone needs someone to rely on. Thanks for making me have this feeling again

Choices.Text: Okay, just let me wrap up some other work first

111090000.Text: @{NICKNAME} @March 7th @Dan Heng, the sealing of the Stellaron is complete, and the spatial distortion is dissipating. Good job.

111090002.Text: We'll need to stay here a little longer

111090003.Text: Don't rush, go at your own pace. The Express will be here, before you're ready to leave.

111090005.Text: I'm craving some juice... Pom-Pom still owes me a glass!

111090007.Text: Not great. Even though the influence of the Stellaron has basically subsided, the existing Fragmentum is too deeply rooted.

111090008.Text: The Eternal Freeze has lasted a very long time, enough to severely impact the ecology of the planet.

111090009.Text: In short, the planet probably won't regain the vitality that it once had a thousand years ago in such a short time.

111090011.Text: Is there anything else we can do?

111090012.Text: ...As Trailblazers, our mission has already concluded successfully. The fate of this world should be handed back to its inhabitants.

111090013.Text: Humankind has always struggled against austere conditions and had always managed to thrive in spite of it. Now that the Eternal Freeze is gone, the Fragmentum has lost its momentum to expand.

111090014.Text: Jarilo-VI will be revitalized. Believe in the perseverance of her people.

111090015.Text: I detected a high-frequency spatial energy surge in the north of Jarilo-VI. You might be interested in checking it out.

111090016.Text: Don't worry. That energy is not related to the Stellaron. It's only an Echo left behind after spatial distortions fade away.

111090017.Text: Inside the Echo, our perceptions of space and time that we are used to will become radically altered, to the point where it might even reconstruct certain scenes from our own past experiences.

111090018.Text: If you're in the mood and wish to re-live those memorable adventures, you can try your luck at places where Echoes can be found.

Choices.Text: We'll need to stay here a little longer
Is there anything else we can do?

111100000.Text: March, Dan Heng, {NICKNAME}  Are you seeing this? This android can actually send messages...

111100005.Text: Hm? What's wrong with that picture? I quite like it...

111100006.Text: Thank you for all you've done for Belobog

111100007.Text: Thanks to Seele, I'm fine now

111100008.Text: Thank goodness. I've already given the orders to the Silvermane Guards to immediately lift the blockade between the Overworld and the Underworld. And some people in the Underworld should have already received the notice

111100009.Text: After closing for more than a decade, the cable car station should finally be reopening soon. If you don't mind, I would like you to come to the Overworld for my succession ceremony

111100010.Text: Woohoo! We wouldn't miss it for the universe!

111110000.Text: {NICKNAME}, March, Dan Heng... How was your rest?

111110001.Text: Pom-Pom has completed the routine pre-departure inspection, so the Nameless is ready to move on to the next world. Come back to the Express when you've tied up all the loose ends

111110002.Text: Oh, right. You must have so many questions about that final battle with the Supreme Guardian of Belobog. Welt and I made some simple analyses that might help shed some light on it for you

111110003.Text: Got it! We will start our preparations now

111120004.Text: Clara, your emoticons are so cute (3)

111120006.Text: Actually, the Robot Settlement has been met with some issues recently

111120007.Text: {F#Big sister}{M#Big brother}, come have a look please...

111120009.Text: Don't worry, I'll be there right away.

111120014.Text: I will be waiting for you at Mr. Svarog's~

Choices.Text: Don't worry, I'll be right there

111130000.Text: The little guy we picked up a little while ago has been fixed

111130001.Text: Drop by to see us if you have the time

111130007.Text: Then I will be waiting for you at Mr. Svarog's!

111140001.Text: Let's meet at the Overworld cable car in a bit

111140004.Text: It's not urgent. I still have to head back to the military lines first

111140005.Text: I'm guessing Serval just left home. If you arrive before us, you'll have to wait for a while

111150001.Text: When I was cleaning, I found two coupons for afternoon tea at the Goethe Hotel. Do you want to come along?

111150002.Text: You can actually clean? Are you for real?

111150003.Text: What made you think of me? Where's Pela?

111150004.Text: Why would I let it go to waste if it's for free? Just wait for me.

111150005.Text: Haha, I knew you would say this!

111150006.Text: She's either writing reports, rushing scripts, volunteering, or sleeping. There's never a good time to ask her out

111150007.Text: It's a date then! Whoever stands the other up is a snow mouse

111150008.Text: Let's meet beside the lobby. I'll be waiting!

111150010.Text: There are so many tables beside the lobby. Which one?

111150011.Text: I'll be there immediately. Order something for me.

Choices.Text: Is it sent? Can you see the text?

111160000.Text: Miss Himeko, I have a question...

111160004.Text: Does our Express welcome new members?

111160005.Text: It's just... I have a friend who wants to join...

111160006.Text: I have a friend who wants to have the coffee you brew!

111160007.Text: New members? Of course. So long as they are willing to travel with us, the Express' door will always be open

111160008.Text: A potential new crew mate? Of course. So long as they are willing to travel with us, the Express' door will always be open

111160009.Text: Oh? This is new, there's no reason for me to refuse

111160010.Text: But, I would like to know more about your friend

111160011.Text: In your experience, what kind of person are they?

111160012.Text: She's a mechanical prodigy with a meticulous mind

111160013.Text: She's a rock star with an uninhibited personality

111160014.Text: She's... I can't say for sure

111160015.Text: That's pretty good, maybe she and I will have a lot in common

111160016.Text: Sounds like a hobby young people would like. Maybe the Express will become livelier now

111160017.Text: No worries. Everything will become clearer after spending some time together

111160018.Text: What I'm saying is, I agree with letting your friend on the Express

111160019.Text: Ask her to take her time packing her stuff. Our Express will always welcome new passengers

111160020.Text: Thank you for your time, Miss Himeko

111160022.Text: Don't worry about it. If there are other issues along the way, feel free to let me know

Choices.Text: Does the Express welcome new members?
I have a friend who wants to join...

111170000.Text: Mr. Yang, are you there? Mr. Yaaaang~

111170003.Text: I have been here the entire time. What's the matter, {NICKNAME}?

111170004.Text: Does our Express welcome new members?

111170005.Text: I have a friend who wants to board the Express. What do you think, Mr. Yang?

111170006.Text: Oh? I'd, of course, welcome them

111170007.Text: Oh? Making friends here is always a wonderful thing. I welcome any addition of new members

111170008.Text: However, do you mind if I ask some questions?

111170009.Text: I'm curious. What kind of friend did you make, {NICKNAME}?

111170010.Text: She's a mechanical prodigy with a meticulous mind

111170011.Text: She's a rock star with an uninhibited personality

111170012.Text: She's... I can't say for sure

111170013.Text: I suppose that means she will have a lot in common with Himeko. That's not bad

111170014.Text: Oh? That's a pretty good hobby. I myself am interested as well

111170015.Text: It matters not. I trust your judgment of character, it shouldn't be too far off

111170016.Text: Anyhow, I would like to welcome your friend

111170017.Text: However, I'm not the decision maker here, but I will put in a good word for you with Himeko

111170018.Text: In my experience, she shouldn't have much objection. So don't worry

111170021.Text: No need to thank me. It's the least I can do

Choices.Text: Does the Express welcome new members?
I have a friend who wants to join...

111180002.Text: [Automatic Reply] Currently operating on the Express. Please leave a message if it's urgent!

111180004.Text: Why are you leaving? I'm not on the Express yet!

111180005.Text: Dagnabbit, my cover has been blown!

111180006.Text: Yay, I got you good, Passenger {NICKNAME}!

111180007.Text: Okay, I'll stop horsing around. What's up, {NICKNAME}?

111180008.Text: Does our Express welcome new members?

111180010.Text: Oh, did you want to bring your friend on board?

111180011.Text: So tell me, what's this friend like?

111180012.Text: Please organize your thoughts before answering, Pom-Pom has to think long and hard about this case!

111180013.Text: She's a mechanical prodigy with a meticulous mind

111180014.Text: She's a rock star with an uninhibited personality

111180015.Text: She's... I can't say for sure

111180016.Text: Oh, Miss Himeko will surely be delighted!

111180017.Text: Rock star? Can Pom-Pom have a copy of her music?

111180018.Text: Forget it then! Pom-Pom was just asking for fun anyway!

111180019.Text: Anyway, Pom-Pom thinks there's no problem. But...

111180020.Text: The engine room is off limits!

111180024.Text: I will try my best to persuade her...

111180025.Text: I don't think she can be controlled

111180026.Text: Whatever the case, these things are not allowed! If this rule can be followed, Pom-Pom will have no objections!

Choices.Text: Does the Express welcome new members?
I have a friend who wants to join...
I will try my best to persuade her...
I don't think she can be controlled

111190000.Text: {F#Big sister}{M#Big brother}, are you free now?

111190001.Text: I want to talk about Pascal...

111190003.Text: Okay. What do you want to talk about?

111190005.Text: Actually, I've thought a lot about it

111190006.Text: I just don't understand... What is Pascal?

111190007.Text: Other robots think Pascal is a Fragmentum creation

111190008.Text: Mr. Svarog thinks Pascal is a normal robot

111190009.Text: Pascal doesn't even know what it is itself

111190010.Text: I think Pascal could even be a human

111190011.Text: {F#Big sister}{M#Big brother}, what do you think?

111190012.Text: I think Pascal is just a robot.

111190013.Text: Pascal might be a Fragmentum creature...

111190014.Text: Pascal is a living human being.

111190016.Text: Pascal does look like a regular robot, but...

111190018.Text: But doesn't Pascal just look like a normal little robot? Also...

111190022.Text: What is the difference between these?

111190023.Text: Some Fragmentum creatures can speak and behave like humans

111190024.Text: While Mr. Svarog looks like a robot, he also can speak, think, and even express "emotions" like us

111190025.Text: So how do we tell what is "us" and what is "them?"

111190026.Text: Only humans have the ability to identify and empathize with other types of creatures

111190027.Text: Simply put, our biological makeup is completely different

111190028.Text: There is no difference between humans and any other types of creatures in the world

111190030.Text: So maybe, Pascal and Mr. Svarog...

111190031.Text: Maybe they're all living, breathing humans too

111190033.Text: That's probably the only way... we can draw a clear distinction between us and other things

111190034.Text: We were born in the same universe, and we are heading toward the same demise

111190035.Text: We're all just different manifestations of the same basic particles

111190037.Text: It sounds complicated, but I will try and understand it

111190038.Text: I don't feel so lost anymore

Choices.Text: Okay. What do you want to talk about?

111200001.Text: Something strange happened in the base again!

111200002.Text: Hang in there. I'll be right over.

111200006.Text: Anyhow, I will be waiting for {F#big sister}{M#big brother} at the usual place

Choices.Text: Don't worry. Give me a moment
What's the matter this time around?

111210000.Text: It's been a while since the incident with Pascal

111210001.Text: {F#Big sister}{M#Big brother}, do you want to visit Pascal?

111210002.Text: Sure, I'll be there right away

111210005.Text: I'll try to check on Pascal first.

111210007.Text: No! Pascal has been very good!

111210009.Text: Anyway, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}, if you're coming to see us, remember to be at the Rivet Town's Tempering Workshop

Choices.Text: Sure, I'll be there right away

111220000.Text: I heard the little robots in the base mentioning a gift they left behind for you in the Tempering Workshop, {F#big sister}{M#big brother}

111220001.Text: {F#Big sister}{M#Big brother}, take a look when you get the chance

111230000.Text: {NICKNAME}, can you read this? You remember the weapon storage that you reported had something weird going on? I got a Guard squad to head over and have a look, and they discovered something you might be interested in

111230001.Text: It'd be better to speak face to face. I'll wait for you at the same old spot in the restricted zone

111240001.Text:
I have a question for you.
Did March, Dan Heng, and you see anything extraordinary in the mountains north of Belobog?

111240002.Text: There was a giant robot called the Engine of Creation

111240003.Text:
That might be what we are looking for. It would be good if I can witness it with my own eyes.
Maybe it's possible to get it re-activated

111240004.Text: If possible, I would like to drive it around...

111240005.Text: I'm sorry. I went off on a tangent

111240006.Text: I recall that there was a device to imprison the Stellaron

111240007.Text: The Stellaron is indeed capable of releasing unusual electromagnetic waves. Maybe that is what we are looking for

111240010.Text: I think I saw lots of March 8ths

111240012.Text:
Oh. Dan Heng may have indeed mentioned this in the records. It's the Antimatter Legion frozen in the Eternal Freeze, right?
It is indeed extraordinary, but probably not what we are looking for

111240013.Text: After the blizzard on Jarilo-VI weakened, Himeko and I detected an unidentified signal there but were unable to decipher its contents

111240014.Text:
Considering the fact that this planet has just gone through the crisis of Stellaron and is still not stable yet, it would be troubling if this signal were to attract malicious parties to this location.
Would you kindly go have a look when you've got the chance?

111240015.Text: No problem. I'll go have a look.

111240016.Text: Thank you. Himeko and I will have some rewards ready for you once you get back

111240017.Text: It's so far and so much hassle. Will Mr. Yang and Himeko at least offer me some modest benefits?

111240018.Text:
Hahaha, don't worry.
Himeko and I will get some rewards ready by the time you return

111240019.Text: I have sent the rough coordinates of the signal to you. Thank you for your trouble

Choices.Text: We saw the Engine of Creation
We saw a device to imprison the Stellaron

121140101.Text: HHelp me! I'm so nervous... *sniffle* There's a new researcher at the Dept of Insight, I can't talk to her

121140103.Text: Snacks? What kind, I wanna see.

121140104.Text: So tired, I think I'm gonna skip dinner

121140105.Text: You're so lazy, don't starve yourself

121140106.Text: This sounds familiar... Hey, did you make me your small-talk practice partner?

121140108.Text: Um... I just needed the practice. I just feel I'm not used to it... not used to chatting with people like this

121140109.Text: You didn't know, but I summoned so much courage just to talk to the people in my dept

121140110.Text: Turns out they were so surprised by me, it's funny! Thank goodness everything went well in the end. Either way... thanks a bunch, master of words!

121140111.Text: Lemme think... is it like this? "Hi, {NICKNAME}, whatcha having for dinner?"

Choices.Text: Did you make me your practice partner?

121140202.Text: I'm planning to have some simple fried rice on the space station

121140203.Text: Don't feel like eating, no appetite

121140206.Text: And then... Wait, hey! Don't take my line!

121140207.Text: ...What did I tell you to do? Did you forget your line again?

121140208.Text: Oh, I can't help it, I... I'm too nervous!

121140209.Text: There are so many things to learn today. I'm still trying to digest

121140210.Text: And then I will make my move! Honestly, I'm not super confident about this, but after texting you, I feel much better... Thanks!

121140212.Text: I want to talk to people from the Department of Implement Arts. Do you think it would sound natural to say...

121140213.Text: Hey, have you had your dinner? What do you feel like having for dinner?

Choices.Text: Don't feel like eating, no appetite
Did you forget your line again?

121140301.Text: There are so many people! Feels like the entire space station is here.

121140303.Text: I don't know what to eat

121140304.Text: Oh, really? I thought you would just send me a picture to show off... What a surprise!

121140305.Text: What time is it now, why aren't you eating yet?

121140307.Text: Uh-huh, I know what you mean

121140308.Text: I'm not hungry, I think I'll skip dinner

121140309.Text: Mm, okay, up to you if you don't want to eat

121140310.Text: How's that? Everything you taught me, I mastered!

121140311.Text: That's everything I can teach, I think you're ready

121140312.Text: Conversing is a form of knowledge. You have much more to learn

121140314.Text: Haha, I'll stop joking around. I want to thank you for teaching me those sentences. I can now mingle with the other staff members

121140315.Text: Honestly, I've never had that many friend requests before... It's all because of you, so thank you!

121140316.Text: The people from the Department of Galactic Geopolitics... The topic they were talking about is completely in line with my research plans! Aaaah what do I do, they have so many people I don't even know how to join the conversation!

121140317.Text: I just do this, right? Hey hey, {NICKNAME}, how's it going? Have you had dinner yet? I haven't eaten. What are you having? Let me have a look!

115000001.Text: ...Don't ignore my message! I've got some good rewards for you!

115010000.Text: You've been quite active, passenger {NICKNAME}. People are saying a lot of good things about you!

115010001.Text: When you come back, I'll have a nice reward ready for you

115020000.Text: Impressive, {NICKNAME}. You are truly one of the Nameless now!

115020001.Text: Same as usual, got a reward for you!

115030004.Text: The initial results are back. This entity born out of space distortions is called a Calyx

115030005.Text: Such entities may contain reality data that has practical value. Exercise extreme caution when you come into contact with it. The very nature of spatial distortion is inexplicable chaos, and it's quite difficult to tell if there are any elements of danger hidden within

115040001.Text: Mr. Yang, this one looks different from the normal Calyxes...

115040002.Text: Hmm, the spawns from this one are of a different species. The materials they produce are actually worth a lot of money

Choices.Text: Mr. Yang, this one looks different from the normal Calyxes...

115050002.Text: This type of Calyx is very sought-after. It exudes a substance that can stabilize Light Cones

115050003.Text: If you find anything curious during your adventure, show it to me. The things you've found so far are all very interesting...

115080008.Text: A construct made from a data stream. Many believe they're linked to Stellarons and the Fragmentum phenomenon.

115080009.Text: What we refer to as relics are objects corroded by the Fragmentum whose data is saved and then reconstructed.

115080012.Text: ...You could consult Herta. She's an expert in relic research.

115090004.Text: Something doesn't feel right on the Express... like there's something I can't see...

115090005.Text: Come back and see me when you have time!

115090006.Text: A conductor shouldn't be this timid.

115090009.Text: Come back in this instant! If we don't solve this, the Express won't be moving an inch!

Choices.Text: A conductor shouldn't be this timid.

115100001.Text: Mr. Yang, is this also a Calyx?

115100002.Text: Yes. Remember, I mentioned that there are many different kinds of Calyxes, and the reality data stored in them may vary

115100003.Text: Remember to be thoroughly prepared before you make physical contact with them. It's not gonna be worth it if you get yourself hurt out of avarice

115110002.Text: Stagnant Shadows are entities that have been influenced by Fragmentum energy and are confined within static space-time

115110003.Text: Once external forces get involved, the space-time within the Shadows will start to flow again, meaning the imprisoned creature or monster may regain activity

115110004.Text: I wouldn't recommend anyone to make contact with the Shadows unless they are genuinely interested in certain priceless relics captured by the Shadows. Just be careful, {NICKNAME}

115120002.Text: It appears to be a rift in space, torn open by the Fragmentum as it erodes reality. The scientific name for this phenomenon is "Cavern of Corrosion"

115120003.Text: No one knows for sure what kind of space the Caverns are connected to. However, research does indicate that valuable reality data is often scattered within these Caverns

115120004.Text: As with the Calyxes, the derivatives of the Fragmentum always carry unidentified risks. Please exercise extra caution if you wish to explore further

115130000.Text: Your memory is worth a lot. If used properly, it can be even more valuable

115130002.Text: I collect fragments of the past and piece them together into a blueprint of the future

115130005.Text: Here you can relive the past and obtain treasures of the future from your past memories

115140000.Text: {NICKNAME}, we've received some assignments. Looks like some planets could use our help.

115140003.Text: The Nameless are always happy to help those in need.

115140005.Text: And we do so without taking any credit.

115170000.Text: {NICKNAME}, it's time to teach you how to better wield the power of your Path.

115180000.Text: Do you feel like you are stuck? You've reached what people call a "plateau," {NICKNAME}.

115180001.Text: While I don't claim to be an expert in this, I do have some tips to share.

115180002.Text: Try it out. Have faith in yourself. I'm sure you can surpass even your greatest expectations.

115190000.Text: Light Cones are sections of time. They possess great power.

115190001.Text: I think you're ready to learn how to use Light Cones.

120030001.Text: I know the Express is there to carry out the trailblaze mission, but there's a question about the Xianzhou I'd like to ask

120030002.Text: Have you heard of... the local legend of Xianzhou, the Foxian Beauty Online Chat?

120030005.Text: I haven't heard of it, is it fun?

120030006.Text: Hmm, you haven't heard of it? Looks like it's suspicious...

120030007.Text: That's very interesting. Send me a link, I'll check it out

120030008.Text: I'm not recommending it to you

120030009.Text: You misunderstand me. The story starts from a certain staff member...

120030011.Text: This is too confusing, let's meet in-person to talk. When you have time, can you come back to the space station and have a little chat with me face-to-face?

120030013.Text: Do we really need to talk about this at the space station? My time is worth a lot

120030015.Text: Mm-hmm, I did a quick math on my allowance this month, I should have enough to hire you! Come, hireling!

120030016.Text: The person you're calling is unavailable. I'll come over when I have the time.

My time is worth a lot
I'll come over when I have the time

120040000.Text: How was it, did you manage to find the in-person operative? Have you already sent the package?

120040001.Text: The in-person operative is not at the Starwatcher Avenue! Where are they hiding?

120040002.Text: I know you're in a hurry, but stop rushing. I'm in a hurry too, but I just couldn't find any in-person operatives

120040003.Text: You should've told me earlier, I'll ask where the operative is

120040004.Text: They sent me a new address. I'll forward it to you so you can get there on time

120040005.Text: If I have a user account, I would've asked earlier without all this roundabout way of getting information. Gimme your account!

120040006.Text: I can't. I will invite you after the task is done, but not now. Hurry and go now

120040007.Text: I've been making myself busy for this long, and NOW you tell me this!?

120050002.Text: Your friend request has been approved. You may now start chatting.

120050004.Text: I've heard what happened. Our meeting in this sea of strangers could be a type of fated encounter.

120050005.Text: From today on, I am your friend in which you can confide your secrets. I will not break confidence and reveal anything you share with another person. I hope you will do the same.

120050006.Text: Really? You're not some kind of high-quality imitation of the real one?

120050007.Text: Am I that unworthy of trust? That is a little disappointing, but believe what you will.

120050008.Text: Don't worry, miss. I will not expose you

120050009.Text: Good, let that be a promise between us.

120050010.Text: This picture is for you, as my meeting gift to you. I hope our communication will soon be more in-depth.

Choices.Text: I don't believe you are who you say you are

120050101.Text: This might sound weird, but can I trouble you to cheat me out of some money?

120050103.Text: Miss, can you send me some credits? I have no money for food

120050106.Text: I hear you are a guest coming from outside the Xianzhou, so from where do you hail? I live in this corner of Xianzhou, yet am still able to meet you across the endless stars. What a fortune this is.

120050107.Text: I guess this must be the miracle of probability  fate

120050108.Text: Actually, I found you through a friend... You should have heard your manager mention this, haven't you?

120050109.Text: I have heard. Even though your initial appearance scared my manager... He still acknowledged your enthusiasm.

120050110.Text: In the midst of the boundless cosmos, we meet, get to know, and will be an important part of so many people's lives. However, everyone's heart has only so much space, and the precious moments we can create together are limited...

120050111.Text: I wonder if we can walk into each other's hearts...

120050112.Text: I'm already walking, I kept walking!

120050113.Text: Um. Does that mean you are a flirt of a {F#woman}{M#man}, with glib words and flighty promises?

120050114.Text: Oh, so sorry, a cat got my phone, let's continue

120050115.Text: Oh, so sorry, a cat got my phone, let's continue

120050116.Text: Oh, how pitiful I would be! I do not wish for your pity. Even if I am but a passerby in your life, I will try my best to become one that you will never forget.

120050117.Text: Sorry, I already have someone in my life

120050118.Text: How nice, I feel much envy toward that person. They must have experienced many fun, important events with you, I presume?

120050119.Text: I will do my best to squeeze in, even a tiny space in your heart would do.

120050120.Text: Ah, my grandfather is beckoning... I have to take my leave for the moment. Let us resume our chat later.

Choices.Text: Can you cheat me out of some money?

120050200.Text: Can I trouble you for a favor? There is something I wish to discuss with another. But of all the people, you were the only suitable one.

120050201.Text: My grandfather's face has begun to sport scars of age, even though foxians are known to be relatively unaffected by the passing of time. He must have been overly burdened.

120050202.Text: I had wanted to stay by his side, helping him to pick tea leaves forever. But, he insisted that I shouldn't stay on the tea farm and should open my eyes to the world at the Starskiff Haven. If I no longer stay by his side, how lonely will he be?

120050203.Text: How do you type so quickly?

120050205.Text: You should visit home often, maybe this can count as you being with him

120050206.Text: ... At some point, I understood my grandfather's insistence. He was worried that I would suffer, and that really moved me.

120050207.Text: If you don't feel well or are too stressed out, drink more warm water

120050208.Text: Thank you for your concern. But I don't think drinking warm water will help with worries and stress.

120050209.Text: You will never guess what I am currently doing. I am assisting my grandfather right now. He is processing the tea leaves.

120050210.Text: At one point, I was seriously ill. My family spent a lot of money on paying the medication bills... It must be difficult for grandfather, alone processing the tea leaves. Now that I've recovered, I want to help him.

120050211.Text: How do you type so quickly?

120050213.Text: You are such a kind-hearted foxian lady

120050214.Text: Why did you act like you have just noticed it? You should be quicker.

120050215.Text: If you don't feel well or are too stressed out, drink more warm water

120050217.Text: ...Would you like to try my grandfather's tea? This is originally for customers, but I can send some to you along the way. Grandfather said that you have been showing your concerns to me, so I should let you try some of his tea.

120050218.Text: He said that you were his granddaughter's best friend. If it's for friends, it's 5600 credits for one tael, 10,000 credits for two taels, and 25,000 for half a catty. How much do you want? Grandpa has worked very hard on this, so he really can't give you all of it for free. Hope you understand.

120050219.Text: How do you type so quickly?

120050220.Text: Forget about typing speed. Buy some tea, how much do you want?

120050221.Text: I want to help you, I should buy some tea leaves

120050222.Text: If you don't feel well or are too stressed out, drink more warm water

120050223.Text: It takes more than hot water to make a good cup of tea. In all seriousness, would you like some top-grade Whale-Tide Thistle?

120050229.Text: Foxian Beauty Daiqing has friend verification turned on, and you are not on their friend list yet. Please send them a friend request. You may begin to chat after the friend request is approved.

120050232.Text: Foxian Beauty Daiqing has friend verification turned on, and you are not on their friend list yet. Please send them a friend request. You may begin to chat after the friend request is approved.

120060003.Text: Who are you? How did you get my number?

120060005.Text: Could you be the tea-selling foxian lady Daiqing?

120060006.Text: Sorry, I overreacted. You were scammed. The Foxian Beauty Daiqing account is a cyber fraud, and I'm that account's alt...

120060007.Text: I didn't think you would send that much money over. My conscience can't handle it. I wanna return the money to you

120060008.Text: Plus, you wouldn't want to lose that much money, right?

120060009.Text: Sure, I'd like to meet up

120060010.Text: Your conscience? I don't think so. I think you're scared. The amount involved exceeded your expectation, right?

120060011.Text: You're not wrong, but u wouldn't want to be scammed either. So I'll return your money. Win-win

120060012.Text: It's just a tiny amount of money, don't worry about it

120060013.Text: Easy for you to say, but ur money hasn't actually been credited into my acct, and it's now being flagged 4 investigation by the IPC safe credit agency

120060014.Text: I don't understand rich dudes like you. You're so rich. Why don't you go and buy some real tea leaves?

120060015.Text: I'm regretting everything. I'll return all the money 2 u

120060016.Text: Save this account in ur contacts as Qingster. I'll contact u when you're at Cloudford.

120070000.Text: {NICKNAME}, I'll leave it to you! Don't forget to deliver the gift I place under your care~

120070001.Text: I hear that gifts to the Foxian Beauty must have a special identifier code. However, the code is constantly changing, so you'll need to meet someone offline and verify your identity as a fan.

120070003.Text:
For logistics identifier codes, please approach an in-person operative with the pass phrase, "Acquaintance from the mortal coil, luxurious gifts from beyond!"

Any dissemination of the logistics identifier codes between members is strictly prohibited. The Foxian Beauty Chat membership status will be revoked for the involved parties.

The Foxian Beauty Chat reserves the right to the final interpretation of this service.

120070005.Text: No healthy enterprise would ever use shady practices like this

120070006.Text: Do you even know how popular Ms. Daiqing is? Her fans are all over Xianzhou, so the IPC hid her address to protect her. I totally get that

120070007.Text: Besides, it's not like we're not allowed to send her gifts. Don't be paranoid

120070008.Text: "Acquaintance from the mortal coil, luxurious gifts from beyond" ...This pass phrase seems familiar.

120070011.Text: You may have plenty of justification, but I'm the one who has to say it, not you

120070012.Text: And now, I'm you and you're me. Go on, I'll allow you to call yourself the "Genius Researcher Wen Furui" while in Xianzhou

120070014.Text: Just try it! Once you've spoken it out loud, you've already surpassed your past self!

120070015.Text: When I praised Ms. Daiqing in the office area, everyone would stay away from me. You see, they're the ones feeling embarrassed, not me

120070016.Text: And now, I'm you and you're me. Go on, I'll allow you to call yourself the "Genius Researcher Wen Furui" while in Xianzhou

Choices.Text: You're more experienced in embarrassing yourself...

120080000.Text: R u at Cloudford? I sent u the address

120080001.Text: ...Sorry, we can't discuss these things openly, u know, so the place is a little hidden.

120090000.Text: I'm almost at Cloudford, get there quickly

120090001.Text: Don't let a slacker do this alone, chop-chop

120100000.Text: Seems like you will take a bit longer to chat with Madam Yukong

120100001.Text: I'm gonna go have a stroll outside. Once you're done, you can find me at the docks

120110000.Text: Something happened just now. I just arrived at the Xianzhou. Are you alright?

120110001.Text: What happened? Is the Express okay? What are you doing on the Xianzhou?

120110002.Text: What are you doing on the Xianzhou? Is the Express okay? What happened?

120110003.Text: I'll pretend that you replied "I'm okay."

120110004.Text: It's a long story. I'm at Cloudford with a Cloud Knight. I'll join you when I come out.

120110005.Text: By the way, the Express is fine. I came here by myself. I'll tell you about it later.

120110006.Text: I'm very interested. Tell me the details.

Choices.Text: What are you doing on the Xianzhou?

120120000.Text: The Cloud Knights invited us to go with them

120120001.Text: Your homeland's got some really big crucibles

120120003.Text: Why are you with the Cloud Knights?

120120004.Text: Why are you near the Aureate Elixir Furnace?

120550000.Text: Benefactor, I'd like to ask you something

120550002.Text: This may be disrespectful, but I'm very curious...

120550003.Text: Is the Express really here just to help the Xianzhou Luofu solve the Stellaron problem?

120550004.Text: Is it really that hard to understand why the Express is here? Can't someone act simply out of the kindness of their heart?

120550005.Text: After all, people who help others without thinking of compensation or risks during the dangerous trips across the cosmos is rarer than air in vacuum

120550006.Text: When the higher-ups of Xianzhou first heard of your reasons for coming, they thought you were here either to seek immortality or the Stellaron...

120550007.Text: Seeking immortality is absolutely forbidden on the Xianzhou, no?

120550008.Text: Yes. As the home of long-life species, countless Elixir Seekers from all corners of the universe come to the Xianzhou to re-enact bygone histories and discover the secret of the Xianzhou residents' immortality

120550009.Text: Stellarons are the seeds of ruin. Why would the Express want the Stellaron?

120550010.Text: But not everyone in the cosmos thinks this way. As a seed dispersed by an Aeon, some desire to obtain its power regardless of the cost

120550012.Text: Apologies, I may have crossed the line. I don't know why I said all this

120550013.Text: I have absolute trust in your sincerity, benefactor, but the powerful masters are bound to think more than a pawn like me

120550015.Text: Is it really that hard to understand why the Express is here? Can't someone act simply out of the kindness of their heart?

Choices.Text: What are you trying to say?

120560000.Text: Say, did you see that, benefactor?

120560001.Text: When the Ebon Deer's stomped the ground, branches sprouted out of nowhere

120560002.Text: Those must be... the Ambrosial Arbor's roots?

120560003.Text: The celestial traces of Abundance are indeed marvelous to behold

120560004.Text: This is the first time I've seen something so miraculous among all my travels

120560005.Text: The fruits on those boughs are sparkling gold, just like what the Xianzhou legends say

120560006.Text: It is said that in ancient times, the forebears of the Xianzhou received immortal fruits like this of the Ambrosial Arbor and turned into long-life species

120560007.Text: If I were to eat this fruit, would I obtain endless life just like the Xianzhou natives...?

120560008.Text: Are you not tempted by such a chance, benefactor?

120560009.Text: Miss Tingyun, wouldn't you be breaching the Xianzhou ban?

120560011.Text: Please pardon me for my rudeness and my little test

120560012.Text: As I thought, you are an honest and righteous person, benefactor

120560013.Text: If you eat this fruit, I'm afraid you won't get to live for a thousand years... but executed by the Cloud Knights moments after.

120560015.Text: But if you manage to get past the Cloud Knights' searches

120560016.Text: This opportunity seems too good to pass up, right?

120560017.Text: Then... Miss Tingyun... did you save a fruit?

120560018.Text: If I say yes, would you want to share it with me, benefactor?

120560019.Text: But I thank you for the thought, benefactor

120560020.Text: Unfortunately, the Ebon Deer is now dust, and no fruit of the Ambrosial Arbor is left behind

120560021.Text: Such opportunities are extremely rare, but they slip away in the blink of an eye.

120560023.Text: Those must be... the Ambrosial Arbor's roots?

Choices.Text: Can't leave if you eat it...

121000000.Text: {NICKNAME}, I'm Xikui, Chief Secretary of the Sky-Faring Commission. The Palace of Astrum is running a small event for visitors to better understand Xianzhou. Would you be interested?

121000001.Text: I don't know if you've met him before, but the Sky-Faring Commission has a speed tester named Tantan. He'd hoped that the public could actively participate in traffic management and become more aware of potential road hazards. To that end, he is planning a "Xianzhou Speed Tester" experience.

121000002.Text: There are too few attendees because the event is too boring, so Madam Yukong asked me to help her get more people. Would you mind attending this? Pretty please?

121000003.Text: I'm very interested. What kind of event is it?

121000004.Text: Is it where I get to enjoy the luxurious Xianzhou life of my dreams?

121000005.Text: Where did you get all these ideas? I haven't even said anything.

121000007.Text: To be honest, I'm not too interested in this kind of stuff. Please find someone more capable

121000008.Text: Please! You know how it is with the internal key performance indices.

121000009.Text: Please, if you help ol' Xikui out with this, I'll reward you fairly. The volunteers all get benefits.

121000010.Text: All you need to do is to record the traffic flow through Starskiff Haven. It's simple work. Just stand in the lane and count.

121000011.Text: Okay, I'll go look for Tantan after this

121000012.Text: Isn't there some kind of device for this sort of task? Sounds inefficient to use humans for this.

121000013.Text: This whole thing is mainly about participation. It's an experience for people to take part in

121000014.Text: It is only when you get involved and count the starskiff traffic flow firsthand that you will get the unforgettable and meaningful experience that this whole event is meant to provide

121000015.Text: ...Hey, why do I have to spell it out so clearly for you!

121000016.Text: If you're ready, please go find Tantan

121000017.Text: So you never share good things with me, but always ask me to help when you're in trouble?

121000018.Text: This IS a good thing! Trust me, all the projects have a set budget. The fewer people involved in your project, the more individual benefits you'll get!

Choices.Text: I'll go find him in a bit
Must you use people for this?
You're just asking because you're in trouble...

121010000.Text: Do you happen to know Mei? Are you her relative?

121010001.Text: Ah, you've got the wrong person. I'm not related to Mei

121010002.Text: But I do know her. Did something happen? I didn't see her today. I even went so far as to save a good piece of meat for her

121010003.Text: Mei had an accident. I'm helping to contact her relatives

121010006.Text: If there's anything I can do to help, lemme know.

121010007.Text: Don't worry. Not a serious issue, but I think she won't be visiting today

121020000.Text: Do you happen to know Mei? Are you her relative?
