130810001.Text: Have you finished all the IPC's assignments

130810002.Text: Yeah... I got all the special assignments that you mentioned done... Is there anything else?

130810005.Text: Pretty good, {NICKNAME}. How'd you do it? I'm still looking at Boothill's details, but you managed to complete so many assignments on your own

130810006.Text: Easy peasy. Nothing I couldn't handle

130810007.Text: ...As expected from someone who fought off the Doomsday Beast with their bare hands

130810008.Text: Well... I didn't do this alone either. I had lots of friends that helped

130810009.Text: Yeah. I'm really grateful to them.

130810010.Text: I know. You've got some "big-shot" connections. Wen Shiqi told me so

130810011.Text: Even Madam Herta favors you. Ah, If I could only be as effective and influential as you someday

130810012.Text: Right, did you get your payment? If you ask me, you shouldn't risk your life for money. Just make enough to live comfortably

130810014.Text: Of course not. It's no big deal... My hair didn't even get messed up. Wasn't anything

130810016.Text: I'm plenty tough. Don't you worry

130810018.Text: Alright. Enough chatter. The department is asking me to submit my report and the page is still blank

130810019.Text: You go home and get some rest. I'll let you know if something good like this happens again

Choices.Text: It was a piece of cake.
Nope, didn't even mess up my hair.

130820001.Text: Greetings, Trailblazer of the Express. I am a member of the Bloodhound Investigation Team.

130820002.Text: After the Sunday Incident, multiple areas of the Grand Theater fell into chaos due to the influence of the Order. Even within the entirety of the Bloodhound Family, there were scarce members capable of handling such a situation.

130820003.Text: After much deliberation, we unanimously agree to invite you to serve as an associate commissioner to participate in certain aspects of the investigation work.

130820004.Text: Due to the urgent nature of the situation, I shall be waiting for you at the Grand Theater. Compensation is negotiable.

130830000.Text: Oh, {F#Miss}{M#Mr.} {NICKNAME}, my dearest festive superstar, how have you been recently?

130830001.Text: Your performance at the venue was so spectacular. It broke our festival's viewership record that endured for half an Amber Era!

130830002.Text: As a token of our admiration, we've prepared a special gift for you

130830003.Text: Unfortunately, this gift just caused an incident, and we really need your help. Do you have time to come along?

130830007.Text: Sounds dangerous, I don't want it then

130830008.Text: Please don't worry. It was just an insignificant accident

130830009.Text: I'll be at the Scorchsand Live Studio awaiting your arrival

130840001.Text: Dear guest, you have collected all the Hanu's Adventure storybooks. That's impressive!

130840002.Text: Since the game was implemented into Dreamscape, you are the only player who has completed the collection mission.

130840005.Text: Check me out! I'm so awesome!

130840006.Text: Of course, you are the one and only

130840009.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>I deliberately placed many challenges in places that ordinary people cannot reach.</color>

130840010.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>You must be someone extraordinary, dear guest.</color>

130840014.Text: I'm trying to keep it on the down-low

130840017.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>Sorry, this is the only way I can communicate with you. After all, there is no privacy in dream communication</color>

130840018.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>Since you've made it this far, I'm sure you've already noticed some clues, haven't you?</color>

130840019.Text: Can you tell what kind of story Lil' Brother Hanu is?

130840020.Text: It's about Penacony's past, isn't it?

130840021.Text: It's about that Hanunue, isn't it?

130840022.Text: It's little Brother Hanu's story, of course!

130840023.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>Urm, that's one way to put it</color>

130840024.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>Hehe, I'm sure you have your own answers in mind, as well as lingering doubts that haven't been resolved</color>

130840025.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>Then let our game continue, remarkable guest~</color>

130840027.Text: It is because you are a premium user carefully selected by Clock Studios!

130840028.Text: As a token of respect for the achievements you've made, we've carefully crafted a <color=#dbc291ff>finale stage</color> for you, narrating the concluding chapter of Brother Hanu's story.

130840029.Text: Go give it a try. You won't be disappointed!

130850001.Text: Dear guest, you have completed the ending of Hanu's Adventure

130850002.Text: Even though our little Brother Hanu did not return to his original form, nor has he made up with his friends, he still protected Dreamville in the end

130850005.Text: Affirmative, this is the ending of Lil' Brother Hanu

130850006.Text: But please rest assured that Brother Hanu will still make appearances in the Clockie series in the future!

130850008.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>However, in reality, "Brother Hanu" isn't as fortunate</color>

130850009.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>The rebellious wolf was wounded on the fringes of the stars, perishing in the wilderness of dreams, forgotten by those within the dream</color>

130850010.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>Even as his clock friend roams far and wide to inscribe his name among the ranks of the festive superstars, his story remains unheeded</color>

130850012.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>Who I am is not important, dear guest</color>

130850013.Text: What on earth are you trying to say?

130850014.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>Nothing, I just wanted to tell you this story</color>

130850015.Text: <color=#dbc291ff>I am but an ordinary person who shall remain nameless, but I refuse to let heroes who deserve recognition be forgotten.</color>

130850017.Text: Alright, dear guest, I won't bother you any longer

130850018.Text: For your support, Clock Studios will present you with an "Aideen Token (Golden Limited Edition)" as a token of appreciation.

130850019.Text: We wish you a pleasant Dreamscape journey, and may we meet again!

130860001.Text: I have a favor to ask...

130860005.Text: Wait for me to return if it's not urgent

130860006.Text: Ah, actually... it's about the Grand Theater

130860007.Text: You may have heard about the Oak Family's past proclamation that guests will be absolutely safe  that is all thanks to Order's power

130860008.Text: But this strength has since almost dissipated on Penacony, which also means that in the present dreams, "death" is not an impossibility

130860009.Text: When my older brother and I crashed onto the land back then, I was thrust into unconscious darkness... But when I awoke, I was surrounded by nurses, and my brother was nowhere to be seen

130860010.Text: I wanted to know if he was safe, but they refused to tell me... It is out of desperation that I would ask you if you could look for my brother in the Grand Theater

130860011.Text: Even a tiny clue would be assuring

130860015.Text: Leave it to me. I'll think of something

130860019.Text: You'll have to prepare for the worst...

130860023.Text: If you find anything, look for me near the ticketing booth

130860024.Text: I'll be disguised as an Intellitron dressed in blue formal attire, to avoid the Hounds' noses

Choices.Text: Don't worry. Leave it to me.

130870001.Text: Dear valued guest, congratulations on achieving excellent results in the Clockie's Extras filming experience!

130870002.Text: The film you previously shot received rave reviews in major theaters, bringing considerable profits to the Clockie Crew

130870004.Text: I make good film not for glory

130870008.Text: Sorry, according to the terms of service of the park, you are not entitled to any related earnings.

130870009.Text: Haven't you received plenty of little gifts from us already?

130870010.Text: Back to the topic, thanks to your meticulously crafted creation, our attractions have been attracting more attention than ever!

130870011.Text: Now, Clock Studios has fully upgraded this project

130870012.Text: We have more varied shooting techniques, richer story content, and more thrilling action sequences waiting for you to experience!

130870014.Text: Hah! It'll be more exciting than games! We can teach you to be a great director~

130870017.Text: Let's give it a try, I promise it's completely different from what it was before!

130870018.Text: If you're interested, come take a look. The Studio's filming equipment is available for you to use anytime!

130880001.Text: Dear valued guest, I saw the film that you shot. It was splendid!

130880002.Text: Thanks to you, we were able to deliver the samples to the investors on time. You truly are the savior of the Clockie crew!

130880003.Text: That's right, I am indeed the savior!

130880005.Text: So, am I just being your unpaid labor!?

130880006.Text: My good {M#sir}{F#miss}, did you just drop me a message? The signal here is getting a bit weak, I didn't receive anything

130880007.Text: Anyways, after watching your film, the investors decided to increase the project's budget. You can expect to experience more exciting films here in the future!

130880010.Text: Making me work for free again

130880011.Text: Give an inch and they'll take a mile

130880012.Text: Oh no, no, it's really not unpaid work, you'll love it

130880013.Text: I won't take much more of your time. Keep it up, my future auteur!

Choices.Text: Of course, you made me work for free!
Making me work for free again?

130890001.Text: Hello, {F#Ms.}{M#Mr.} {NICKNAME}! Did I catch you at a good time? I'm developing a new collaborative project for my humble store. The psychoanalysis chart suggests that you may be interested in this.

130890003.Text: You can call me Dr. Edward! I run the Dreamscape Sales Store on Penacony.

130890004.Text: Dreamscape Sales Store? You can buy Dreamscapes now?

130890005.Text: Experiencing different Dreamscapes is as good as living out different lives! Exciting Dreamscapes can of course be sold as products.

130890006.Text: Enough of this Dreamscape talk for now. I'm more interested in knowing how you got my number

130890007.Text: It's just some simple psychoanalysis, my dear friend.

130890008.Text: My store will be launching several thrilling dream bubbles. We're tentatively calling it the "Apocalyptic Shadow" series.

130890009.Text: The selling point of this series is to place the user in the middle of an apocalypse and have them personally feel the despair of watching on helplessly as the world collapses.

130890010.Text: Despair? That's the selling point? Who would want that?

130890011.Text: You may not know this, but being in a happy and harmonious environment for too long can numb one's spirit, and soon, nothing will be able to evoke joy anymore. This is where we come in  to offer a small stimulus of sorts.

130890012.Text: My secret partner hopes that you, dear {F#Ms.}{M#Mr.} {NICKNAME}, can help to give her a little push in this.

130890013.Text: If you can make the mass production and serialization of the Apocalyptic Shadow series a reality, you can be sure that you'll be offered generous material rewards as recompense.

130890014.Text: Why is your secret partner specifically looking for my help?

130890015.Text: I'd love to answer you, but I'm not privy to that information. She has the right to keep trade secrets, well, a secret, and I understand and respect that.

130890016.Text: Who is this secret partner of yours?

130890017.Text: I'd love to answer you, but I'm not privy to that information. She has the right to keep trade secrets, well, a secret, and I understand and respect that.

130890018.Text: Sorry, this isn't a good time.

130890019.Text: No problem. We're happy to wait till you're available.

130890020.Text: Do meet with her to discuss the details of your collaboration when you have the time. From what I know, she should be in "a city chiseled out of the Primordial Dreamscape" now.

Choices.Text: How did you get my number?
Who would want to feel despair?

130910000.Text: Hello, dear user! Current data suggests you have collected three arcade machines. Can you provide a quick review based on your gaming experience?

130910001.Text: It's okay. Nothing too surprising, but not bad either.

130910002.Text: Thank you for your review! We will continue to adjust and optimize the game's content based on the feedback you have given for this test. Stay tuned!

130910003.Text: Pretty interesting. You guys keep it up.

130910004.Text: Thank you for your review! Your support is our greatest motivation!

130910005.Text: As for the game's quality, well, I'd rather play something else these days...

130910006.Text: Thank you for your review! We are sorry that you are unsatisfied with your experience. We will do our best to adjust and optimize all aspects of the game as soon as possible.

130910007.Text: We will be offering generous rewards for the players involved in this test. Please complete the rest of your progress.

130920000.Text: Guys, let's make our way to the Radiant Feldspar

130920001.Text: I'll wrap things up soon. Let's meet at the Aft Pool in the stern

130920005.Text: By the way, what are you doing on the Radiant Feldspar, Miss Himeko?

130920006.Text: By the way, what have you been up to lately, Miss Himeko?

130920007.Text: Hey! I was about to ask the same thing!

130920010.Text: Be patient, you'll find out at the opening ceremony

130940000.Text: The Message Doll has initiated a temporary conversation.

130940002.Text: That feels so cool, don't you think?

130940004.Text: Just give me the coordinates, and I'll defuse the bomb

130940005.Text: Well, there are only 1,000 bombs. Miss Sparkle never breaks her words~

130940007.Text: I'm just here to spill the beans on Miss Sparkle's motive, got it?

130940009.Text: Don't text me anymore. I don't want Pom-Pom to get the wrong idea

130940010.Text: Think you can mess with me? Well, you just stepped on chewing gum. I'll stick to you forever!

130940012.Text: By the way, Miss Sparkle hasn't even revealed her motive yet! Aren't you curious?

130940014.Text: Yeah! You're getting the hang of it, aren't you?

130940015.Text: So, are you curious about why Miss Sparkle is doing all this?

130940018.Text: I'm going offline, catch you later

130940019.Text: No, don't go offline! Please! Please!

130940020.Text: Heh, just kidding~ Let's get back to business!

130940021.Text: Do you remember the prophesied "three deaths"?

130940022.Text: What's that got to do with you?

130940023.Text: Who knows? All I can say is that someone paid a hefty sum to hire Miss Sparkle as the director at Penacony.

130940024.Text: Seems like it's a friend she made while gaming. The client told Miss Sparkle to make sure the "three deaths" happen in the safest way possible

130940025.Text: In return, they shared their "script" with Miss Sparkle

130940026.Text: And what happened next... Well, a smart cookie like you can surely guess, Gray Hair!

130940027.Text: However, Miss Sparkle isn't some control freak. She let the actors decide how the story would unfold for themselves

130940028.Text: Surprise question! Did you press the "Mutually Assured Destruction Button" that Miss Sparkle gave you?

130940030.Text: Well, congratulations! You're the one who reshaped the third death!

130940031.Text: No, that button seems way too suspicious

130940032.Text: Hmhm, you're a cautious one, huh?

130940033.Text: But no worries. Since more than half of the actors pressed the button, the third death went exactly as planned!

130940034.Text: I didn't even get the button!

130940035.Text: Oh, really? Well, good luck scoring a ticket next time then!

130940036.Text: But no worries. Since more than half of the actors pressed the button, the third death went exactly as planned!

130940037.Text: She soared up in the sky and set off the most epic fireworks Penacony had ever seen, giving a grand finale to this beautiful dream

130940038.Text: And she herself was safe and sound! Happiest ending ever!

130940039.Text: So, congrats, Gray Hair. After all, you're the one who made the call and actually saved that firefly girl

130940040.Text: And that means Miss Sparkle will get paid as promised!

130940042.Text: By the way, to celebrate the successful grand finale, Miss Sparkle has decided to share another secret with you, Gray Hair

130940047.Text: Dr. Primitive is a huge fan of bananas

Choices.Text: I couldn't do it at all.
More juicy gossip? Tell me more.

130960002.Text: Hey! Hey, hey! Beep beep boop boop! Say something!

130960005.Text: I just found out that the customer service, medical, catering, and entertainment departments now belong to you

130960006.Text: You already overcame the Formidable Four... my subordinates

130960007.Text: Head to the top of the airship next. I will be waiting for you in the secret room

130960009.Text: Are you trying to schedule a fight with me? Send me the location. I'll come and smash you

130960011.Text: What? No, that's not what I mean. Never mind. You'll understand when you get here

130960012.Text: I think I've seen this on TV before... Based on the plot, might you be the president of the Music Club?

130960015.Text: The airship's scenery is great, but just a shame that only the strong are worthy of treading upon the deck

130960016.Text: Can you hear the tick-tocking? Only the strongest clock will make the mightiest sound

130960017.Text: I can hear the ticking within your heart. Come quick, I'll be waiting for you in the room where the gifts were hidden

Choices.Text: What are you? Trying for a fight?
Are you the Music Club president?

130990000.Text: Found the composition inspiration you wanted

130990003.Text: I truly appreciate your hunt for my inspiration, Sound Master

130990004.Text: I say, where did you find this secret art?

130990006.Text: I played a melody with the origami birds

130990008.Text: I ran into a band comprising only origami birds

130990009.Text: But their beat is indeed divine

130990010.Text: The special sound ninja training will commence. When you return, you will surely see results

131000000.Text: You can find inspiration in Peppy's barks

131000001.Text: I'm totally a savant at this

131000002.Text: As expected from the Sound Master!

131000003.Text: The special sound ninja training is going swimmingly. I shall not squander your efforts, Sound Master

131010001.Text: I can't hold it in any longer.

131010003.Text: Why don't you tell me what's happening first?

131010005.Text: The band ran into a few problems during practice.

131010006.Text: Rappa's training methods are... very atypical.

131010008.Text: She said that training was going well in the group chat

131010009.Text: Well, maybe this is "going well" from her perspective.

131010011.Text: I'll keep observing for now. Sorry to bother.

131020000.Text: A rapping trashcan. Bet ya wouldn't have dreamt of it

131020001.Text: Even though you are indeed in a dream

131020002.Text: There are such well-built ninja cans in this world? What a wonder

131020003.Text: The sound ninja's prowess has all seen vast improvement with the special training. Please be at ease

131030005.Text: Must I send you a message only when something's wrong...

131030008.Text: I have trouble keeping up... with the special training

131030010.Text: Since Dreamweaver Academy had you join the band

131030011.Text: That means your capability has been acknowledged

131030012.Text: Don't worry. I'm the band manager

131030015.Text: You don't get it at all

131040001.Text: I heard that three escapees have already been found hiding in the Shackling Prison. The Ten-Lords Commission has also confirmed that the remaining two have passed away.

131040002.Text: () I'll have Chiyi prepare some rewards for you. Go find her. She will understand.

131040004.Text: They give off a very lively vibe. It's hard to imagine the words are coming from Madam Xueyi

131040005.Text: I don't know why, but they seem kinda odd

131040006.Text: (`) Think of it as a sudden impulse of mine

131040007.Text: If you have time, go seek out Chiyi

131050001.Text: Found my note at the front desk?

131050006.Text: I ran into someone calling herself a Galaxy Ranger, so I want to check her identity with you

131050008.Text: Finally got the signal back. This place is a total dump

131060000.Text: Himeko, we've made a smooth landing on Amphoreus. It looks like there's a civilization down here.

131060002.Text: The car's blown up! Pom-Pom, drop some food down, quick!

131060003.Text: Finally freed from the Express! Farewell, my prison!

131080000.Text: {NICKNAME}, can I bother you with something?

131080001.Text: Not sure if you're available now?

131080004.Text: It might not be the best time, is it urgent?

131080005.Text: It's not urgent. I will keep it short

131080006.Text: Lemme guess, did March 7th cause trouble again?

131080007.Text: Let's be clear, I'm not March's parent

131080008.Text: If there's an issue, please look for Mr. Yang, Himeko, or even Dan Heng

131080009.Text: Don't worry, Miss March is okay. It's just that I have some matters I need to trouble you with

131080010.Text: The Wardance had its ups and downs, but ultimately it ended smoothly

131080011.Text: It's not just "ups and downs," it's straight up a roller-coaster

131080012.Text: You're right, {NICKNAME}, this Wardance has had too many incidents

131080013.Text: You're speaking in generalities and omitted the most important part: the Wardance

131080014.Text: ...But the issue at hand is not about the Wardance, so allow me to skip that topic

131080015.Text: Although there were many bumps along the way, luckily we had the aid of the Express Crew. I express my sincere thanks to you and the Crew

131080016.Text: However, merely sending a message to express gratitude is not considered proper etiquette

131080017.Text: I hope to be able to meet the Express Crew one more time and personally see everyone off

131080018.Text: Of course. Where should we meet?

131080019.Text: That's great, Miss March and Dan Heng have also agreed to meet

131080020.Text: What did March and Dan Heng say?

131080023.Text: Then, we shall meet at the Starskiff Haven. I look forward to seeing you there

131080025.Text: I might be a bit late, ahahaha...

Choices.Text: It might not be the best time...
I might be a bit late...

131090000.Text: When Rappa and I got to the rehearsal room, none of you were there. Where did you all run off to?

131090001.Text: Latecomers will have to carry the instruments

131090004.Text: I will... also be there later

131090006.Text: How long are you guys gonna drag this out?

131090007.Text: Fine, I'll elaborate for the rest.

131100000.Text: Everyone! I have just thought of a magnificent mantra

131100001.Text: "Magical colors, streak across the wicked night. Evil is vanquished, dissipated in fright. Fret not in the journey through darkness and watch  the Ninja Heroes ascend the stage, fast and furious!"

131100002.Text: Goodbye! Miss Rappa, please don't cry for me

131100004.Text: No no no, it's a mantra that spits real bars

131100007.Text: We're really the last ninjas now

131100008.Text: (ritual dancing) Aahhh, return... Spirits return to us (spinning in circles)... Spirits return to us

131100009.Text: Guitar Pro has left the chat

131120004.Text: I tried asking for help from the teacher at Dreamweaver Academy

131120005.Text: But the attitude from the other two schools is firm, so there's no room for negotiation

131120007.Text: My Super Perception could not sense Ninja Initiate Guitar's traces at all

131130000.Text: I'm watching the livestream for the music party. It's fantastic!

131130001.Text: Mechanical Fever should be preparing for their next performance

131130002.Text: Not only is the composition amazing

131130003.Text: Peppy super duper loves your music!

131130004.Text: The instrument performance is also awesome

131130005.Text: Fam, this is just sooo sick!

131130006.Text: There are clips of your performance all over the internet!

131130007.Text: Want to consider collaborating with us for a show?

131130008.Text: If I haven't been so busy recently, I would have definitely come and join the fun

131130010.Text: The group is just like that. Everyone is just chatting on their own

131130011.Text: Since there are so many fans, why not do a paid livestream next?

131130012.Text: Luckily the band performance wasn't interrupted

131130014.Text: You guys have so many fans and supporters

131130019.Text: When playing in a band, of course we have to hype the whole world up!

131130020.Text: Everyone  we are Mechanical Fever, the Rock 'n' Roll Ninjas!

131130022.Text: If you have the energy to stand around chatting, why not come over here and start practicing

131130025.Text: I'm so thankful that there's music in this world

131130026.Text: March 7th invited you into the group chat

131140001.Text: How is testing the Divergent Universe? The Human Comedy, heh... Screwllum surprised me. His kingly qualities indeed mean he's more open to accepting external suggestions, unlike the other Geniuses.

131140002.Text: In my spare time, I've compiled a new batch of data as an iterative sample for this version of the Divergent Universe.

131140003.Text: I'll send you a copy. Think of it as practice material for a test.

131140004.Text: Attachment Investigation on the Lifecycle of Cosmic Intelligent Life Forms - AE 2157 has been sent

131140005.Text: I'm only a tester. Thinking is not in my job description.

131140007.Text: By the way, how long would it take to finish reading the document?

131140010.Text: It doesn't matter if you know me or not, but you should know yourself and the data I sent. That's very important.

131140011.Text: The Equations allow you to experience different lives. It's not about making you become someone, but for you to have a clear idea of where you want to go.

131140012.Text: Even if the genius' research doesn't concern you, you shouldn't stop pondering the subject of "life."

131140013.Text: Don't worry. For users such as yourself, just reading the literature review and the conclusion sections will suffice.

131140014.Text: Not even Screwllum will read through this verbose document word by word.

131140015.Text: You are the partner Screwllum mentioned?

131140016.Text: Screwllum is trying to understand and resolve the differences and conflicts among intelligent lifeforms. I only provided him with some materials and advice during academic exchanges.

131140017.Text: As for "partner"... that's just him overstating my contribution.

131140018.Text: I have met many people. If Screwllum says that they're his partner...

131140019.Text: They'd be so happy that they might even burst out laughing in the middle of the night.

131140021.Text: Yet you declined his invitation, why?

131140022.Text: Geniuses are like stars. The value they create can illuminate an entire planetary system.

131140023.Text: The mundane is always trying to follow their footsteps, only to be blinded and become lost.

131140024.Text: He has his topics, and I have mine.

131140025.Text: One needs to walk their own path. This is true to both you and me.

131150002.Text: When you're looking for inspiration for your music, can you bring me along?

131150005.Text: It's just that you're starting to feel a little distant

131150008.Text: *sigh* Rappa has constantly emphasized to me that working together with you will be rewarding.

131150009.Text: If it's just assessing music, it should be okay.

Choices.Text: What's with the change of heart?

131160001.Text: I just refreshed the assignments terminal, and they've all been completed!?

131160002.Text: Of course they are. I am a master at taking assignments. These things are no challenge for me

131160003.Text: Take me with you on your next speedrun. I'm still a newbie

131160004.Text: No way, the terminal is obviously glitching

131160006.Text: ...Liar. I've checked, and they're all clearly completed

131160007.Text: I would expect no less from the space station's hero

131160008.Text: Oh yeah, the system says that all of your rewards have been sent out in real time. Make sure you check how much you've been paid and let me know if there is anything wrong

131160009.Text: I'll get brother Shiqi to make sure you're paid down to the last decimal

131160010.Text: Ah, I can't even be bothered to check

131160011.Text: Those amounts are just pocket money to me, barely worth getting out of bed for

131160013.Text: Any money you don't need, you can give to me. I really need it. Thank you

131160014.Text: Haha, thank you. I appreciate the sentiment

131160016.Text: I see you've been rushing around for days now. Get some good rest. I won't disturb you any longer

131160017.Text: Just keep on "trailblazing." I'll contact you again next time there is an opportunity!

131170002.Text: There are people selling your autographed photo on the school forum, it's going for 500,000 credits as of now

131170003.Text: Did you venture into a new business?

131170005.Text: Oh! Must be the Pepeshi sitting next to me in class!

131170006.Text: He's selling it for such a high price?

131170007.Text: I'm gonna need a share of it

131170009.Text: I'll explain later. I need to have a friendly conversation with him

131180003.Text: During a class at Fortune Academy, I met a Pepeshi who answered the roll calls for others

131180004.Text: ...That's the guy who's selling my autographed photos

131180005.Text: He even prepared a service package that's particularly exorbitant

131180006.Text: Maybe this is what they meant by "having business sense"

131180007.Text: In the Dreamweaver Academy class, the student beside me was drawing Clockie fanart

131180008.Text: That technique... those lines... and the plot are all great

131180009.Text: Are you there for classes or fan conventions?

131180010.Text: The class at Charmony Academy is super fun. The entire classroom is full of cosplayers!

131180011.Text: My deskmate is an Origami Bird

131180015.Text: I also want to attend a class after hearing all this you've said

131190000.Text: Say~Cheese~ invites {NICKNAME}, Dan Heng to the group.

131190001.Text: Just brought in two fresh bananas!

131190010.Text: So, you like Slumbernana Monkeys, too!

131190012.Text: Nice to e-meet you all! I'm {NICKNAME}, a visiting student from the Astral Express. I'm single and a huge fan of Aetherium Wars. I can't tell you the total values of my personal assets, but I hope we all get along well!

131190013.Text: Gosh, that's quite the serious banana!

131190016.Text: Don't be so uptight like an unripe banana peel. Loosen up a bit!

131190017.Text: Awww! Lovely to e-meet you all! *:.. oo ..:*Hey, it's {NICKNAME} here! Feel free to call me Ga-lac-tic Base-baller if you like! *cool posture* I'm a green lil' freshman! Add me as your friend on social media, bana!

131200001.Text: Sorry. Montana seems to need you for something

131200002.Text: Let's go and check out the area around the stage

131210004.Text: I've got some news for you

131210009.Text: I have a feeling it might be bad news...

131210013.Text: Yeah, {F#she's}{M#he's} been on the move everywhere these days.

131210014.Text: ...You're not planning to leave us, are you?

131210015.Text: Let's catch up when you're free. Welt and I will be waiting for you in the Parlor Car

131220001.Text: No way you topped my leaderboard score!

131220003.Text: You've got some nerve! Your score is obviously fake. You lost to me and still had the guts to put it on the leaderboard.

131220004.Text: I, {NICKNAME}, swear to the sky I haven't cheated! If I did, I'd throw myself off Dreamflux Reef right now!

131220005.Text: Nice driving skills you've got there. Wanna come over and give Bladie some lessons?

131220006.Text: But I thought Bladie had a driver's license?

131220007.Text: I'm not convinced he got that license legally.

131220008.Text: I'm not slandering him. One ride in his car and you'll totally get it.

131220009.Text: You're a pretty good driver yourself. Why don't you teach him?

131220010.Text: I was actually trying to be nice and teach him.

131220011.Text: But he was too stubborn and claimed he already knows how.

131220012.Text: I couldn't get through to him, and didn't feel like wasting my breath.

131220014.Text: Simulated Spheroid Racing: 26 dropped an update. Gotta go play it!

131220015.Text: Enjoy my "gift" and hit me up if you want to play together sometime.

Choices.Text: But I thought Bladie had a driver's license?

131230002.Text: Depends on what you're asking about.

131230003.Text: Peppy mentioned you topped its score on the leaderboard.

131230004.Text: I'll fund you to be Peppy's personal trainer.

131230006.Text: But humans and dogs have different anatomies. My techniques might not work for it.

131230007.Text: Absolutely! Peppy's got determination. I always enjoy Peppy's company.

131230008.Text: You couldn't have asked a better person. I'm totally game!

131230009.Text: I spoke with Miss Himeko and heard you're all pretty swamped.

131230010.Text: Let's save it for when you're free. No hurry, we've got plenty of time.

131230011.Text: Come see Peppy when you have time. It's been missing you a lot.

Choices.Text: Humans and dogs aren't built the same...

131240001.Text: Azh do recovruy perod(^o^)/~hggy9makng a twobrotha asgu

131240002.Text: Asta, what gibberish are you sending? I can't understand a word of it.

131240003.Text: Peppy! Stop hijacking Asta's phone and use your own account!

131240005.Text: Peppy wouldn't stop pawing at my phone!

131240006.Text: So it was texting you all along!

131240007.Text: It was gloating about outscoring you on the leaderboard.

131240008.Text: It wanted to know if you're doing well in Penacony.

131240009.Text: Is everything okay? Need any help?

131240011.Text: Everything's fine, I'm just not in the mood to chase high scores.

131240013.Text: Please thank Peppy for me. It really does care about me. I'm so touched.

Choices.Text: Peppy, stop hiding behind Asta's account!
I'm fine, just not into chasing high scores.
No need, but tell Peppy thanks.

131250004.Text: We all received a game resource package, and it has your name as the "Honorary Producer."

131250005.Text: Hehe, that's the power of our friendship!

131250006.Text: Come and hear what we have to say about your work, producer

131250007.Text: This game reminds me of the Aetherium Wars game that was popular in Belobog a while ago... Was it not also developed by the same company?

131250008.Text: Looking at the master diviner working so hard really gives me a sense of fulfillment! Thank you for making my dream come true

131250009.Text: Gray Hair, I didn't know you were capable of doing something like this. As I expected of you~

131250010.Text: It's much more complete than the original version and is 30% more fun.

131250011.Text: I heard this game is already on its way to being shared with more people. Its promotional impact on the Express is immeasurable

131250012.Text: Danksi didn't say we'll release it that soon. I didn't even have time to write a press release

131250013.Text: All of you are right. Praise me more. I like it

131250014.Text: Heh, the trailblazing expedition is always accompanied by joy and serendipity. Looks like you've experienced it firsthand

131250015.Text: Thanks to you, the Express has revived its festive traditions, and I've finally regained a bit of that old feeling

131250016.Text: Keep this momentum up and the trailblazing going, {NICKNAME}. One day, you'll leave your own legacy on this Nameless milestone

131260000.Text: {NICKNAME}, we heard about your unfortunate accident during the race when you and your vehicle were sent flying by obstacles. The organizing committee has an insurance payout ready for you.

131260001.Text: For more information, visit: TRANSFER LINK

131260002.Text: Wait, I had insurance? What's the payout amount?

131260003.Text: Wait a minute. Sent flying? So that doll wasn't your setup? This doesn't match what the Organizer said.

131260004.Text: About time this race got something right.

131260005.Text: Wait, why is this asking for a transfer?

131260006.Text: This looks fishy. Are you trying to scam me?

131260007.Text: A cautious one, huh, Gray Hair?

131260008.Text: How'd you like flying through the air?

131260009.Text: Crash into my face again and see what happens.

Choices.Text: Why are you sending me a donation link?

131270000.Text: Dear contestant, our systems detected illegal weapons during the race that destroyed our advertiser's promotional dolls.

131270001.Text: This action gravely violates our rules. Cease using such abilities immediately to maintain fair competition. Don't bother contacting the Organizing Committee with questions  they'll ignore you anyway.

131270002.Text: Enough with the charade, Sparkle. I know it's you.

131270003.Text: Why text me? I still have a bone to pick with you for messing up the race. Are you begging for mercy? No answer? I'll assume you are!

131270004.Text: Wait, what I blew up... I figured it out! You're Sparkle, and you planted those dolls! They all have that same look  don't even try to deny it.

131270005.Text: You were my target all along!

131270007.Text: Having a good time on that Spheroid ride, Gray Hair?

131270008.Text: Allow me to spice things up and join your game.

Choices.Text: I'll take that as you begging for mercy.
That blast was for you, Sparkle!

803620001.Text: That dream bubble had nothing left but laughter

803620003.Text: Just some combat challenges. With my skills, I cleared them easily

803620004.Text: I knew it. Meeting you must be karma for that mysterious figure

803620005.Text: That "Try-Not-to-Laugh Challenge" wasn't even remotely funny. I kept a stern face the whole time

803620006.Text: I told you, this challenge wasn't made to make you laugh

803620007.Text: Thanks to your help, we carried out a full investigation. Based on what we've found so far...

803620008.Text: This is most likely a "trap dream bubble" created by the Masked Fools for "people with a peculiar sense of humor"

803620009.Text: They say some folks in the cosmos don't react to jokes or comedy at all. No smiles. No laughter. Not even a ripple of emotion

803620010.Text: And for people like that, our super serious battles? They're hilarious

803620011.Text: Humor really is a strange thing, huh?

803620012.Text: The Masked Fools wouldn't miss a chance to crack up these stone-faced types. That's how this dream bubble came to be

803620013.Text: Thanks for helping me investigate this "Try-Not-to-Laugh Challenge" case, I've transferred the money to your account

803620014.Text: Please don't go saying things like "I don't need this small amount of money" in your heart, okay? Have a wonderful life!

Choices.Text: I kept a stern face the whole time

140010000.Text: Did you both get a good rest?

140010001.Text: I'm ready to tackle something big!

140010003.Text: The room conditions are great, and it's comfortable to rest here. Is there something you want to discuss with us?

140010005.Text: That's not good. Is there an issue with the bath's atmosphere?

140010006.Text: The room's perfect. I just pushed myself too hard yesterday. Anything you want to discuss?

140010007.Text: Oh, it's you  I was expecting someone else.

140010008.Text: Who were you expecting? Did someone beat me here?

140010009.Text: Nothing. Do you need anything from us?

140010011.Text: Teacher Trianne has located Castrum Kremnos. Hurry to the Chrysos Heirs' Bath in the Marmoreal Palace, and let's get ready to take on Nikador!

140010012.Text: Ah, you can rest for a bit longer. No rush

140020001.Text: It's been a while since the conductor greeted us with a "Hey, hey!"

140020003.Text: We're gearing up for a warp jump, aren't we?

140020006.Text: Yes, it's time for a warp jump!

140020008.Text: Regarding our next destination, a passenger has given us a special tip

140020009.Text: As usual, we'll discuss this at the navigation meeting

141000001.Text: Esteemed guest, are you near the dromas workshop?

141000002.Text: It seems a commotion has broken out there

141000003.Text: Do you think you can go and take a look? I can't get away at the moment

141000005.Text: Thank you. I'll leave you to it

141000006.Text: Am I getting roped into unpaid labor again?

141000007.Text: Today is gonna be another fulfilling day

141000008.Text: Compared to assignments, this is more along the lines of a request between friends

141000009.Text: Being personally named by Lady Aglaea...

141000011.Text: You needn't stand on ceremony. Consider it a favor among friends

141000012.Text: Oh, right. Please refrain from mentioning my name

141010001.Text: Little Gray, are you free right now?

141010002.Text: What is it? Are we busting monsters or people?

141010004.Text: How did you know I'm about to grow mold from boredom?

141010005.Text: Just send me a word. I'll teleport over there immediately

141010006.Text: No rush, just a little favor we'd like to ask

141010007.Text: When we woke up today, our favorite book was gone. We couldn't find it anywhere

141010010.Text: Oh me, oh my, at this point, we'll have to find a diviner to help

141010011.Text: I thought you know how to do that?

141010012.Text: It's not the same. Different Fate Titans bring different directives

141010013.Text: There's a super-duper-mega-ultra powerful diviner in Okhema called Pasithea. Allegedly, she can tell the future just by dreaming

141010014.Text: However, due to some past circumstances, it's not advisable that we meet her...

141010019.Text: All three of us said please, so you must go, okay?

141020001.Text: Little Gray, did you find Pasithea?

141020002.Text: Have no fear when I'm on the job

141020003.Text: But I'm currently dealing with something urgent

141020004.Text: Give me some time, and I'll get to the bottom of it when I'm back

141020005.Text: We don't know what you're facing

141020006.Text: But keep it up, Little Gray!

141030001.Text: Little Gray, what did Pasithea say?

141030002.Text: She asks you to lift your pillow

141030005.Text: We've looked for it high and low

145000000.Text: This message is automatically sent by the system

145000001.Text: If you see this message on the teleslate, then congratulations: You have cleared the initial test for the enigmatic ceremony I named Golden Scapegoat. You might be already used to the various mysterious phenomena you have encountered in Amphoreus. Just like the test you just completed. That thing appeared during the Era Bellica period. It was seen as an ill omen and caused many uproars in the world. But as time went on, people gradually learned to ignore it.

145000002.Text: But if you're like me and wish to discover what secrets lay beneath these goat masks, whether there are powers beyond the Titans dominating our world, and what this world's secrets are according to Evoccultism's teachings... Then, I recommend that you study the Golden Scapegoat alongside me and uncover these grand mysteries lost to the people of this world.

145000003.Text: When you pass more challenges, you can find out how to contact me through the teleslate.

145000004.Text: The goat head is pretty interesting. Don't keep me in suspense. Let's meet up.

145000005.Text: Don't waste your data. I'm not your target audience

145000006.Text: What is Evoccultism? A kind of biological evolution?

145000007.Text: This message is automatically sent by the system

145000008.Text: When you pass more challenges, you can find out how to contact me through the teleslate.

145000009.Text: Tsk. I don't actually want to repeat everything, but this cursed teleslate is too limited in function. (Well, maybe I just don't know how to use it?) I can't manage to make it automatically message me when you finish the challenge.

145000010.Text: So, I set a variable first. (Please forgive me, it cannot be 1, but I promise it's not bigger than 5.) When you finish your challenges at a few different spots, your teleslate will receive my personal information. This way, you can contact me in reality (if you wish).

145000011.Text: Sigh, dear friend. It's a shame that these teleslates aren't as good as seances (a pity I cannot perform such a thing, as I am not a priest). Such troublesome matters cannot be blamed on me...

145000012.Text: I hope we can uncover the secret behind the Golden Scapegoat!

145000013.Text: Reserved service has concluded. Transmission automatically concluded

Choices.Text: I like this game. Contact me.

145010000.Text: This message is automatically sent by the system

145010001.Text: To those of a like mind as I: You have claimed 4 Golden Scapegoat tokens. This makes me believe that you, like me, have a unique interest in them.

145010002.Text: My name is Avilius (as you might have guessed). My personal abilities are limited, and so I am less than capable when it comes to discovering more secrets connected to the Golden Scapegoat. But you might be. Speaking clearly, I just so happen to know a tenured scholar in the Council of Elders. This senior academic helped me analyze some information relating to the Golden Scapegoat and also secretively installed this automatic transmission system in this goat head.

145010003.Text: It is said that the Golden Scapegoat system has a unique network strategy. Each time we complete a challenge, we will hear ancient murmurs with different meanings (though I can't tell them apart at all, the senior academic can indeed give different translations for each murmur). Of course, Evoccultism believes miracles are more likely to be naturally occurring instead of human-made. And so there might not be an architect sending us messages from eons past when it comes to the Golden Scapegoat.

145010004.Text: In fact, from the eyes of that senior, the Golden Scapegoat is more likely a fracture or a projection cast upon reality by some grand mystery. The rules behind it are the result of higher laws being compressed by reality.

145010005.Text: I think we're drifting off-topic. Anyway, no matter where you got those 4 tokens, the special functions designed in the teleslate by that academic are enough for you to hitch onto the system and let you receive the details I'm inputting here.

145010006.Text: As I've mentioned, my name is Avilius. If you ask the people around the Kephale Plaza, you will be able to find me.

145010007.Text: You who share our ambitions  I shall anticipate your arrival there.

145020000.Text: As for the matter of the Golden Scapegoat, let's discuss it here!

145020001.Text: The group owner is the scholar senior I have great respect for, she

145020002.Text: The group owner has muted all members

145020004.Text: Let's wait until we've accumulated some new discoveries before discussing further. Based on the pace before, it'll probably be promising once you've collected 4 more goat heads

145020006.Text: Posting here some hypotheses Avilius came up with. It's actually quite entertaining

145020007.Text: "In the distant Era Creatura, at the dawn of creation, the world was brand-new. Back then, many things had no names, and people relied solely on pointing: Sheep were not necessarily sheep, and humans were not necessarily human. At that time, there may not have even been fire. People ate raw flesh, and in their brutality, might even have resorted to cannibalism. Later, a hero or a heroine stole the Coreflame from the Titans, who had no such intention to give fire. Thus, those who feared fire became sheep, and those who did not become human. But this hero remembered that, in the past, there was no difference between humans and sheep. So they wore a sheep mask ever after, as a punishment for creating a divide between shepherd and sheep, even though they brought civilization to humanity. In nightmares deep in the night, he or she has become darkness itself, endlessly pursuing and hunting themselves."

145030000.Text: The group owner has muted all members

145030001.Text: You should have 8 goat heads by now. I've just completed 3 new sections of analyses on my end, so I'm slower than you, but I'll catch up soon (actually, the recent goat heads contain more than 1 segment that can be deciphered)

145030003.Text: Attachment Golden Scapegoat's Mutterings 2 has been received

145030004.Text: Here's another of Avilius' hypotheses. I think he should give literature serious thought instead of mysticism

145030005.Text: "When the black tide first appeared in the world, people were deeply terrified. They had been shepherds for so long that they had forgotten they, too, could be hunted and slaughtered like sheep. At the end of the Era Chrysea, humanity faced an unprecedented, all-encompassing defeat. The old heroes had died, while new heroes had yet to be born. Everything was in disarray, and all hope seemed lost. The once-thriving civilization now cast a vast shadow, and those with ambition could only chew on an ashen, bitter fate with decaying, cavity-ridden teeth."

145040000.Text: The group owner has muted all members

145040001.Text: Did you get 12 goat heads already? My output is still 3 sections. And as you can see, it's from an even earlier batch

145040002.Text: But no matter, I will make up for it. I'll try to surpass you in total count

145040003.Text: Attachment Golden Scapegoat's Mutterings 3 has been received

145040004.Text: As usual, the following is Avilius' free-association

145040005.Text: "Neither humans nor Titans can exist independently of the world itself. The past imprints itself upon the future, acting as both the foundation and the constraint of all things. As these constraints multiply, humans grow further and further from the Titans they were once close to... eventually forgetting the past, unaware that both sides could be subject to a higher destiny. If we interpret it this way, then the roles of shepherd and sheep could apply to any of us  they could even be one and the same (just as hinted in the opening passage!)"

145050000.Text: The group owner has muted all members

145050001.Text: Like I said before, this is to make up for the missed progress

145050002.Text: I feel like the more we discover, the less we know

145050003.Text: There are 8 sections this time. I'll send you in 2 documents

145050004.Text: Attachment Golden Scapegoat's Mutterings 4 has been received

145050005.Text: Attachment Golden Scapegoat's Mutterings 5 has been received

145050006.Text: Also, what you just completed should be the final challenge that we know of

145050007.Text: Avilius will pass you the information extracted from it later (oh right, he's been learning how to assist me lately)

145050009.Text: If I unmute him, he'll spam this chat up again

145050010.Text: You know what? Since it's the last one, it should be fine if you look for Avilius yourself. He's much quieter in person

145050011.Text: But personally, after we're done, it's best not to engage him in playing conspiracy games even if this research is valuable

145050012.Text: It seems none of us would figure out what exactly happened in history long past

145060000.Text: The group owner has disabled mute for all members

145060001.Text: Listen to this, this experiment really worked!

145060002.Text: I dreamed I was trapped in a prison, completely sealed off with no light at all  I could only feel the rough shape of the cell. I searched everywhere for a source of light and finally struck pieces of metal together to create a spark. But to my surprise, the whole room went up in flames with a loud "whoosh," and it startled me awake!

145060005.Text: That which one thinks about during the day is what one dream about at night

145060008.Text: Who's to say our adventures are not the dreams of a certain Titan?

145060009.Text: However... Out of the two hypotheses "Humans evolved from Titans" and "Humans are dreamed up by Titans..." which is more likely? This calls for a new experiment to be designed!

145060010.Text: The group owner has muted all members

145060011.Text: Quit it with the conspiracy theory

145060012.Text: Like I said, it seems no one could know what exactly happened in history long past

145060013.Text: Dreams are too subjective and are not evidence

145060014.Text: If you want to design a new experiment, then its method of proof needs to be more objective

145060017.Text: This world might be seeing new changes soon

145060018.Text: When that time comes, the text that we aren't able to decipher might reveal its true meaning

145070100.Text: Esteemed guest, the Garmentmaker in "Eternal Holy City" Okhema can no longer detect any more nymphs

145070101.Text: But a plethora of butterflies just appeared in the "chrysalis room"

145070102.Text: Come take a look at the Garmentmaker's when you can

145080000.Text: I'm Hekate, the one who hired you for that out-of-town investigation

145080002.Text: No worries. Glad I could help

145080005.Text: I've been spending more time with her lately, though this contact serves a different purpose

145080006.Text: We've already submitted the evidence to the Council of Elders, and Rhadaman should be facing judgment soon

145080007.Text: He was well hidden. It's a wonder how Possephone ever tracked him down

145080008.Text: Your assistance ensured the smooth success of this operation. Thanks again

145080009.Text: If you need help in the future, feel free to ask

145090001.Text: I didn't mean to intrude, but could you spare a moment to chat with this old soul?

145090004.Text: Sorry, I'm a bit tied up right now...

145090005.Text: Oh, no worries, you don't have to reply. I can just ramble on to myself...

145090006.Text: I'd like to talk about Possephone and Hadez...

145090007.Text: Back then, I wasn't really in favor of them being together

145090008.Text: Possephone is a simple soul. Treat her well, and she'll do the same for you

145090009.Text: Hadez... I've always thought he was too calculating

145090010.Text: But Possephone liked him, so I respected her choice and wished them the best

145090011.Text: Now, part of me wishes I had been a strict and unyielding bad mom

145090013.Text: Thanks for your help with the investigation. I'll keep on searching

145090014.Text: Thanks for putting up with my rambling for so long

145090015.Text: Thank you so much for your help, {NICKNAME}

145100001.Text: Hey~ The space station sent someone over with gifts. I asked the Express conductor to leave the items in the Parlor Car. Please come and help yourselves~

145100002.Text: This sounds like Asta's doing. What would someone as rich and eccentric as her send us?

145100003.Text: Weird... Is today some kind of special occasion? Why would she suddenly send us gifts?

145100004.Text: It's all snacks and supplies and some interesting gadgets invented by the researchers

145100005.Text: They said they wanted to repay us for our kindness and help back at the space station. Everything is a small token of their appreciation

145100006.Text: It was nothing, really. They didn't have to do all this

145100007.Text: I have no interest in the gifts, but I appreciate their sentiments.

145100009.Text: By the way, make sure you come along, {NICKNAME}. There's a little robot in here that would be perfect for you

145100010.Text: Huh? Why me? This is all a bit sudden

145100012.Text: What kind of robot? Does no one else want it?

145100013.Text: After some discussion with the conductor, we figured it would be best for you to take it

145100014.Text: Pom-Pom was going to use it as an Express cleaner. But considering how busy you always are, {NICKNAME}, you can probably use an assistant. So, the little robot is all yours

145100016.Text: Remember to visit the Parlor Car. We'll keep your stuff here for now

145100018.Text: Speaking of snacks, there are certain passengers that I would like to remind not to sneak off and eat them all by themselves! Make sure you leave some for others

Choices.Text: Do you people not want it?

145110000.Text: Sorry. I was busy and just saw this message

145110002.Text: Yep. Caught a few more today. Just finished teaching them a lesson

145110003.Text: You're still doing all this even though you're retired?

145110004.Text: I was decommissioned, not retired. Plus, to long-life species, 200 plus is the perfect age for working hard

145110005.Text: I digress. You want to know what happened with those Drift Bottles, right?

145150000.Text:
To {NICKNAME} and company:
Of the Grove's circumstances we are now fully cognizant, and for thy most diligent efforts we harbor the deepest gratitude  indeed, no words could adequately convey the depth of our appreciation.
Alas, the holy city presently faces sundry complications, and manifold duties command our attention, precluding us from extending proper welcome  for this oversight we express sincere regret.
Furthermore, following thy arduous voyage, rest must be prioritized. The particulars of recent events shall be deliberated upon the morrow. So it is written.

145270000.Text:
To my dearest Masters,
Greetings to you all. I am Boothill, the Galaxy Ranger.
As the evening breeze of Asdana carries with it the tender whispers of approaching summer, I humbly pray that your noble selves remain in radiant health, untouched by the vexations of seasonal ailments, so as not to miss the splendor of this midsummer's enchanting beauty.
Though but a humble fugitive, it is my profound honor to stand alongside your esteemed selves in the pursuit of the Holy Grail.
As such, with a heart brimming with reverence and gratitude, I extend to you a most earnest invitation to grace Clock Studios Theme Park with your presence. There, I shall humbly offer a modest feast of wine and fare in your esteemed company.
In this season of summer's retreat, Clock Studios Theme Park has transformed into a realm of poetic wonder, a paradise on earth that promises to etch unforgettable memories upon your hearts.
Should you deign to accept my invitation, I would be overjoyed beyond measure. I shall eagerly await your reply. May this humble gathering serve as a cherished testament to the bond we share, and may it bestow upon you a moment of delight and respite amidst your noblest endeavors.
With the highest regards and the deepest wishes,
Here's to you,
Salutations from,
Yours humbly,
Boothill

200110001.Text: When we step on the Express and follow in the footsteps of the Nameless, it means that we will become accustomed to things that are not of the ordinary.

200110002.Text: You will push beyond your limits without even realizing it.

200110003.Text: {NICKNAME}, have you experienced anything like that before?

200110005.Text: Indeed, I have suddenly started receiving many new assignments

200110006.Text: Messages represent the connection between people.

200110007.Text: If you receive messages every day, it means that the connection between you and others has deepened during your Trailblaze journey.

200110008.Text: But connections also need to be maintained. Take care to manage your time wisely.

200110009.Text: You can't count yourself as worthy of the Nameless if you can't handle several assignments at the same time.

200110010.Text: Plan your route efficiently so that you won't run around the same circle twice. Otherwise, you're just doing extra work.

200120000.Text: {NICKNAME}, I just got a great idea!

200120001.Text: We can make an animation based on the Express!

200120005.Text: Hear me out on this one.

200120006.Text: Of course, the story would take place in the distant past.

200120007.Text: And for obvious, practical reasons, we will most likely need to modify most of the plot in the end... but that's just an afterthought.

200120008.Text: I've been out of the industry for a long time now, and frankly, I'm especially interested in hearing what you young people think.

200120009.Text: For example, what would you find most compelling in such a story?

200120010.Text: It should be an adventure with ups and downs

200120011.Text: It should be a thrilling, relentless battle

200120012.Text: In truth, I just want to see the protagonist fully upgrade their equipment

200120013.Text: Unique settings and a collision of destinies  can't do without either of those.

200120014.Text: Companions who have each other's backs, and powerful enemies  can't do without either of those.

200120015.Text: That is, the protagonist keeps getting upgrades and getting stronger, right?

200120016.Text: Next question: When do you think this story should end?

200120019.Text: When everyone's equipment is fully upgraded

200120020.Text: Maybe you could serialize it? That sort of thing has been done before.

200120021.Text: After reaching a satisfying conclusion... stories like that have been told before in animation.

200120022.Text: If the story is forced to continue after everyone's equipment has been fully upgraded, the battles may become unbalanced.

200120023.Text: I'm actually really glad that you see our journey that way.

200120024.Text: Looks like I'll have to make this dream come true after my next retirement...

200120025.Text: {NICKNAME}, wait until that time comes, and then we'll have a nice chat again.

I want to see the protagonist fully upgrade their equipment
When everyone's equipment is fully upgraded

200630001.Text: I wanted to go to the Sleepless Earl to listen to stories, and guess what.

200630004.Text: I met my old abecedary who taught me in the lyceum!

200630005.Text: I didn't know he's at the Luofu right now, what rotten luck...

200630007.Text: I thought meeting old teachers is a good thing?

200630011.Text: When I was still studying, he barely ever acknowledged me.

200630012.Text: What's a lyceum? And what's abecedary?

200630013.Text: I'm an alien, I don't know these words

200630015.Text: Oh, it's nothing. I probably don't know much more than you do anyway

200630016.Text: Let me think about how to explain it to you, hold on.

200630018.Text: A lyceum is a school, and an abecedary is a teacher.

200630019.Text: *sigh* I really didn't want to remember that. It's so awkward.

200630021.Text: So I was raised in a military family, and my mom is very strict about me practicing my martial skills.

200630022.Text: So I had to get up to spar with her before the crack of dawn, then go to the lyceum after that.

200630023.Text: But by that point, I'm exhausted. I couldn't even hear anything the abecedary said without falling asleep.

200630024.Text: Just now, when he saw me, he yelled, "Hey, isn't this Sleepy Sushang?"

200630025.Text: Everyone on the street immediately started staring at me, I was just so embarrassed.

200630029.Text: *sigh* I hope I won't run into him ever again...

200640000.Text: {NICKNAME}, I finished reading the files that you shared with me from the data bank.

200640001.Text:
After sitting in this Seat of Divine Foresight for so long, I can't help but overlook the world outside of Luofu's delves.
That, combined with the long lifespan of the Xianzhou humans, made me feel that the entire world is as boring and changeless as myself.
However, now I've read the wondrous encounters of the Express Crew, I realized that using my endless lifespan to travel various worlds would be a fun venture indeed.

200640002.Text: Unfortunately... I still shoulder Luofu's countless duties and cannot accompany your group. But if I were to retire one day, what should I do?

200640003.Text: Our Express is pretty big. You can come visit, general

200640004.Text: Hahahaha, if that's a personal invitation, {NICKNAME}, then I might consider it.

200640005.Text: Perhaps you can swap places with Fu Xuan and be the master diviner

200640006.Text: Hahaha, don't ever mention that to me again. The master diviner is an exceedingly busy job. No ordinary person can face its arduous work.

200640007.Text: I feel the Realm-Keeping Commission's work is quite relaxed...

200640008.Text: Hahaha, that would truly take me back to my origins.

200640009.Text: My parents were scholars of the Realm-Keeping Commission and were responsible for researching and recording the histories of long-life species. The paperwork involved was literal torment.

200640010.Text: That reminds me... My dream as a young boy was to become a Galaxy Ranger.

200640011.Text: Pity that life never goes the way you want it to go.

200640012.Text: If given the chance, where would you want to go?

200640013.Text: Perhaps I'll go seek out animals that have already gone extinct in Xianzhou.

200640014.Text: Let us stop for today. Qingzu just carried in another pile of documents for me. Just looking at them gives me a headache.

200640016.Text: I'm sorry I can't be of help...

200640017.Text: It's enough for me to squeeze out some time to chat with you, {NICKNAME}.

200640018.Text: All in all, I shall return to work. Farewell!

200650000.Text: {NICKNAME}, I have a rather abrupt request.

200650001.Text: Please let me hear it, general!

200650002.Text: When you are free, could you please spend some time sparring with Yanqing?

200650008.Text: That is true. What of it?

200650009.Text: Then, can I spar with you first?

200650010.Text: That way, you also get to test my capabilities

200650011.Text: Haha, I am already well aware of your capabilities, {NICKNAME}.

200650012.Text: Oh my. You saw through me

200880000.Text: Say, have you heard of a knowledge-sharing website named Knowfinity?

200880001.Text: The myriad of topics on this website encompass a diverse range, leaving no stone unturned. Occasionally, I, too, receive invitations to answer some of the questions posted there.

200880002.Text: Look at this one: <u>How can a leader maximize their direct report's motivation to work</u>.

200880003.Text: Why exactly do they want to invite me to answer this question...?

200880004.Text: You are an outstanding leader... Of course, as the master diviner managing the Divination Commission, a workplace question like this is a piece of cake for you

200880005.Text: As the master diviner, you are highly experienced in the workplace, and the other diviners rally around you in unity.

200880008.Text: "To govern is to harmonize  higher-ups and underlings must not encroach."

200880009.Text: "Let those keen of sight be on the lookout, and let those sharp of claws to go on the hunt. Let all use their greatest strength, then all shall attain peace."

200880010.Text: The most important aspect of the workplace is to ensure everyone is employed to do what they do best, and do not intrude upon each other's jobs.

200880011.Text: "How can a leader maximize their direct report's motivation to work" is, in fact, all about "letting the right person do the right job."

200890009.Text: To be honest with you, Ruoyue's skills are nothing to scoff at amongst the former employees of the Commission.

200890010.Text: {NICKNAME}, I have a favor to ask of you.

200890011.Text: Please go do a divination in Ruoyue's shop whenever you pass through Exalting Sanctum, so she will get some business.

200890012.Text: ...That's the least I can do as her former boss.

200890013.Text: You want me to help your old employee's business?

200890014.Text: Sure, I can do that... but can I ask why?

200890016.Text: You are rather empathetic today. I'm having a hard time adjusting to this version of Fu Xuan...

200890017.Text: What, do you take me as some emotionless divination robot?

200890019.Text: It won't be hard for you to personally help her business, right?

200890020.Text: Put yourself into my shoes for a moment...

200890021.Text: As the head of the Divination Commission, for me to go to a street side stall to get her fortunes read... wouldn't that be rather strange?

200890023.Text: *sigh* It was I who personally drove her out of the Divination Commission.

200890024.Text: The hexagram from the Matrix of Prescience showed that Ruoyue will be driven out of the Divination Commission by my own hands. I fear that implied she might be in mortal danger if she stayed in the Commission.

200890025.Text: Of course, I never told her this. I just told her that I divined this outcome between us.

200890027.Text: There's no evidence to prove this future will come into being

200890028.Text: Ruoyue being safe and sound right now is the best evidence.

200890029.Text: I understand why you are shocked. The ways of divination are obscure and unpredictable. I had a similar reaction to you for the first century during which I studied divination.

200890030.Text: If one day the Matrix of Prescience told you to quit your job, would you do that?

200890031.Text: If such a day comes, then I will do it.

200890032.Text: Please make sure you go and see to her business.

200890034.Text: Factual results determine everything, and there is no way to examine might-have-beens

200890035.Text: Indeed. Ruoyue being safe and sound right now is the best evidence.

200890036.Text: I'm impressed that you're not surprised... The ways of divination are obscure and unpredictable. I was constantly confused for the first century during which I studied divination.

200890037.Text: If one day the Matrix of Prescience told you to quit your job, would you do that?

200890038.Text: If such a day comes, then I will do it.

200890039.Text: Please make sure you go and see to her business.

200980011.Text: Thinking about the fear and anxiety I felt back then somehow makes me think of you.

200980012.Text: I was worried that you might be feeling the same way.

200980013.Text: Thank you for your concerns, Little Gui. I've grown accustomed to it.

200980014.Text: Yeah, I guess so. You've been through a lot more than I have.

200980015.Text: Ah, those were tough times for you. It really tugs at my heartstrings.

200980016.Text: Hah, don't worry about me. Take better care of yourself! Seriously, make sure you take breaks no matter how busy you are.

200980017.Text: Well, let me say it again.

200980018.Text: If you ever need help, remember you can always count on me, your Little Gui.

201020000.Text: {NICKNAME}, is everything alright on the Express?

201020001.Text: Seems fine, are you feeling alright?

201020002.Text: Haha, nothing too serious. After a few days cooped up in the apothecary, my injuries have healed to the point of being negligible.

201020003.Text: It must've been because that fight was close to the Ambrosial Arbor, so my body's healing speed exceeded all expectations.

201020004.Text: What made you think of us, General?

201020005.Text: The Express Crew are my friends who went through life and death with me. Isn't it normal to think about my friends?

201020006.Text: By the way, {NICKNAME}, perhaps you've already heard from Dan Heng about some recent events.

201020007.Text: My mentor has returned to the Luofu, gathering old friends to settle past grudges. She sent an anonymous letter to the Express to invite Dan Heng, which is quite... abrupt. I hope it hasn't caused any disturbance to everyone.

201020008.Text: No worries, we have weathered worse storms

201020009.Text: Your mentor is something else to be able to move on the Express unnoticed. After I found the letter, I only told Pom-Pom and Dan Heng, no one else

201020013.Text: Please relay my apology to the conductor for the rudeness of my mentor.

201020017.Text: I hear the Express will be journeying far again. I hope for your peace and safety.

201020019.Text: Dan Heng, I, and everyone else on the Express will definitely come back to visit!
