201060022.Text: Okay, okay, stop! Now this is getting embarrassing...

201060023.Text: Trust me. It's not embarrassing once you get used to it. Please come to me often and let me shower you with compliments, {NICKNAME}.

201060024.Text: Because compliments lift spirits and bring out beauty.

201060028.Text: Is that all? I'm pretty sure I'm better at this compliment game.

201060029.Text: What a wondrous soul stands before me!

201060030.Text: O, honorable and magnificent Lord Argenti!

201060031.Text: Your heart can touch the deepest of the night sky, recherch yet tantalizing.

201060032.Text: You're gracefully endowed with innate valor, unyielding resilience, profound worth, untapped potential, unwavering disposition, and boundless happiness.

201060033.Text: March forth with grace, for you are simply peerless!

201060035.Text: Please allow me to shower you with praise once more!

201060041.Text: I can't believe someone would refuse praise... There are truly noble souls in the world!

201060042.Text: I'm really impressed by your qualities, {NICKNAME}.

201060044.Text: You're welcome. I swear, I mean every word of what I said

Choices.Text: Is that all? I'm better at this.

201070000.Text: {NICKNAME}, I just finished a space race during my journey

201070003.Text: Oh, nothing, it's only the highest level of racing competition in the entire cosmos

201070004.Text: That's why every year, I make modifications to the engine of the One and Only

201070005.Text: All types of aircrafts, ships, and shuttles are welcome to participate in the race.

201070006.Text: And if you're interested, I can make introductions for the Astral Express to join the competition

201070007.Text: We do, however, encounter dust storms during the race from time to time

201070008.Text: These storms bring in star debris that sticks to the One and Only. It shines so brightly that I can't help bringing myself to remove the debris every time I see it

201070009.Text: Oh, yeah. Pom-Pom once mentioned that too

201070010.Text: We once got caught in a dust storm, too

201070011.Text: That substance clings to my armor and glows

201070012.Text: And it might get stuck in Pom-Pom's fur, making it a hassle to clean

201070013.Text: I'm already picturing it in my mind

201070015.Text: I'd love to see Pom-Pom driving the Astral Express in the race

201070016.Text: I believe the Astral Express would impress everyone

201070017.Text: I'm looking forward to competing with you

201070018.Text: Alright, enough small talk for today. I have to clean my One and Only

201070019.Text: When the opportunity arises, I'd like to invite {NICKNAME} and the Crew to participate in the race

Choices.Text: I'd love to see Pom-Pom in the race.

201080001.Text: I'm struggling with what to have for dinner tonight.

201080002.Text: This might seem sudden, but I need your opinion on flavors.

201080003.Text: Which one do you like best, {NICKNAME}? Soft bread, hard bread, or perhaps buttered bread?

201080004.Text: Fluffy soft bread with a sweet flavor sounds like a great choice...

201080005.Text: Yes, it's indeed a great choice.

201080006.Text: I think hard bread with its coarse texture would suit you.

201080008.Text: How about trying buttered bread? It could be something new for you.

201080009.Text: Hmm, that sounds interesting. Maybe I'll give it a try.

201080010.Text: Due to my rigorous training and constant traveling, I rarely had anything other than hard bread.

201080011.Text: But of course, I personally enjoy its rustic texture and slightly bitter flavor.

201080012.Text: It's just like the serene view outside the window right now.

201080013.Text: Great. I'll go with my usual choice of hard bread.

201080014.Text: Do you have any recommendations for what to have with it?

201080015.Text: Milk would be a perfect pairing.

201080019.Text: What could be the best pair for hard bread?

201080020.Text: The answer is: Another type of bread.

201090003.Text: Strange. Why won't it go through?

201090004.Text: Could it be that the signal from the Shackling Prison is still blocked?

201090005.Text: Hmm... they proposed maintenance last year, but it's been delayed in the approval process...

201090006.Text: So, what were you trying to send me?

201090008.Text: My sister loves thriller novels. Lately, she's been running out of interesting stories, so I thought I'd write something for her. It's my first attempt, though.

201090010.Text: The attachment failed again. I'll copy and paste the content here. It's a bit long, and I hope you don't mind.

201090012.Text: Judges have forever grappled with the burden of excruciating decisions. Among them, few weigh on their conscience as heavily as the relentless pursuit of the betrayer. Motivated by greed, disdain, or the intoxication of danger, comrades can swiftly transform into enemies. And when the moment arrives to dispense justice upon a former ally in the name of the revered Ten Lords, the torment becomes unbearable.

201090013.Text: The place I now journey towards bears witness to a heart-rending spectacle. Long ago, I meticulously constructed a trap to ensnare the perpetrator who conspired with the Denizens of Abundance. This elusive criminal, known only as "Seawater," peddled invaluable secrets, unraveling the intricate tapestry of the Alliance within the Ryansnaut Sector. Engaged in an unyielding battle with "Seawater" for an extended duration, I now find myself poised to tighten the noose.

201090014.Text: As I hasten towards the scene, a vivid tableau unfolds within my mind. A greenhorn Cloud Knight, a spirited street performer, a guileless foxian girl, and one enigmatic Nameless... Which among them could be "Seawater"? And when the truth is ultimately unveiled, how shall I confront the inevitable, merciless denouement...?

201090015.Text: Without warning, an arrow, launched from the shadows, pierces my heart. I collapse to the ground, I find my gaze locked onto the countenance of the assailant...

201090017.Text: Are you seriously planning to send me the entire novel through text messages!?

201090021.Text: That's all I've managed to write so far. I'm a bit stuck and need some advice.

201090022.Text: It's great. Keep going with it.

201090024.Text: While I'm not entirely satisfied with it, you've given me the confidence to keep going.

201090025.Text: To be honest, it's a bit long-winded. It lacks detail, and now I understand why you're stuck.

201090026.Text: I feel the same way. The story definitely needs refinement.

201090027.Text: Well, I'll try reading more of my sister's favorite novels and maybe I'll learn something about storytelling intricacies.

201090028.Text: Why are we the suspects in your story?

201090029.Text: My sister mentioned that it's easier to write a novel when the characters are based on familiar faces.

201090030.Text: I've been thinking about it. Maybe it's because you guys are always too kind for me to imagine you doing anything evil. No wonder I'm stuck now. Perhaps I should draw inspiration from the criminals I usually deal with.

201090032.Text: The biggest question is, who is this "Seawater" anyway?

201090034.Text: Maybe that's why I'm struggling with the writing.

201090035.Text: Thanks for your advice. I'll think about it and send it to you once it's ready.

Choices.Text: What are you going to send me?

201100001.Text: Or, are you free sometime in the next few days?

201100002.Text: And if not, how about next week?

201100003.Text: And if not, how about next month?

201100004.Text: I'm busy these next couple of days.

201100005.Text: Never mind. If you are free afterward, would you like to watch an immersia together with me?

201100006.Text: Feel free to call me anytime of the day

201100007.Text: Great. Would you like to watch an immersia together with me?

201100008.Text: What's with the sudden interest in immersia?

201100009.Text: Well, since my sister is a puppet and only able to spend a limited amount of time in the mortal world, I always try to make the most of it by taking her to watch interesting things, have fun, and enjoy good food.

201100010.Text: Lately, I've been thinking about exploring some new immersias with her, but due to my job, I've lost interest in many things, and I'm not sure if the immersias I choose will be enjoyable. It's such a rare occasion for my sister to be in the mortal world, and if I waste her precious time on dull immersias, I'll feel incredibly guilty, to the point of mara corruption. That's why I need someone else's suggestion. I believe someone as knowledgeable as you could help me find captivating immersias

201100011.Text: That makes sense, but everyone has their own preferences. I wonder what kind of immersias Miss Xueyi likes?

201100012.Text: My sister loves thrillers. Murder mysteries, spy flicks, zombies, and basically anything with thrilling plots. However, I find it difficult to discern what is "thrilling." If you were like me, immersed in the first-person experiences of various mara-struck individuals all day, you will also come to feel that no immersia can be "thrilling." That's why I need your help to tell me what is "thrilling" with the eyes of an ordinary person.

201100013.Text: I'll get back to you once I've got the tickets.

Choices.Text: I'm busy these next couple of days
For you, I'm free any time
What's with the sudden interest in immersia?
What type of immersia does Xueyi like?

201110000.Text: Sometimes I may have some thoughts that I'm not sure if you'll get, but it might be worth a try. So, I'd like to share them with you.

201110001.Text: In the Shackling Prison, I've been immersed in memories of mara-struck individuals for days on end. Meanwhile, in the outside world, I constantly hear people complaining about trivial things like having too much homework or feeling exhausted with only 2 dual-hours of playtime each day. They complain about being tired.

201110002.Text: For me, even a short break for half a dual-hour every few days would be a precious gift from the Ten Lords.

201110003.Text: Younger people tend to have a lower threshold for stress.

201110004.Text: That's true. Many people don't realize how good they have it

201110005.Text: Well, the more I think about it, the more I understand them. Actually, I used to complain about those things too when I was younger.

201110006.Text: I vaguely remember when I was a child, believing that I wasn't cut out for work. My sister would comfort me, although I can't recall exactly what she said. It was only after I started working that I realized no one is truly cut out for work, especially in the Ten-Lords Commission. Even if you don't have what it takes, once you drink the Wine of Oblivion, you simply do what needs to be done.

201110007.Text: However, I never let my daily stress build up to the point of mara corruption. That's why I visit Du's Teahouse after work to enjoy some tea. His tea works wonders.

201110008.Text: If you're free, don't hesitate to join me.

201120001.Text: He's missing, and not even Screwllum and Herta can find him. I bet he must be slacking off somewhere

201120003.Text: I don't even know what he looks like...

201120005.Text: He took the bait. I found him

201120007.Text: All the credit goes to the "Stephen Bait"

201120008.Text: Despite the name, it's actually quite simple

201120009.Text: All you need is a piece of fruit cake

201120010.Text: Doesn't matter how much you get. As long as the flavor is right, it will get the job done

201120012.Text: Herta has clear preferences. An interesting Curio should do the trick.

201120014.Text: Screwllum has always been punctual. The cuff links I prepare for him never come in handy.

201120015.Text: I'm curious about "Ruan Mei Bait" too

201120020.Text: The aroma of plum blossom cake always brings me back to the time I spent in the lab with my mother when I was little. I loved to show off my work to her at that time

201120021.Text: Instead of bait, I think it's more of a reward to me, which I do miss a lot

201120022.Text: Is it some kind of research?

201120023.Text: It's human nature to be inquisitive, and all research has a purpose

201120024.Text: But for me, there are only certain kinds of research that are worthy of my attention...

201120027.Text: Looks like the Anti-Truth Serum hasn't worn off yet

Choices.Text: I don't even know what he looks like...

201130006.Text: Okay, is this accidental pocket texting again?

201130007.Text: So many messages bombarding me with stickers these days...

201130009.Text: So many messages bombarding me with stickers these days...

201130011.Text: I enjoy sharing new stickers with my friends too.

201130013.Text: I'm in the middle of research for a new lifeform

201130017.Text: Your friend Ruan Mei has gone offline

201130020.Text: Your friend Ruan Mei has come online

201130024.Text: It possesses intelligence, but I can't assess its exact level yet

201130025.Text: It is not susceptible to injury, but it needs the help of other mediums to survive

201130026.Text: With all due respect, I don't understand a thing you just said

201130027.Text: I think I get it, but not fully

201130028.Text: Are the stickers you see merely stickers?

201130029.Text: Or could they be a special kind of lifeform?

201130030.Text: They use a language made up of pictures and reproduce when they are sent in messages

201130031.Text: Well... There's a chance they might have already settled down in your phone

201130033.Text: Do you believe what I said?

201130034.Text: I believe what you're saying, some stickers can be like their own little lifeforms

201130036.Text: There's nothing special about these stickers, no matter how I see them. You're pulling my leg, aren't you?

201130037.Text: No worries, just take it as me joking around

201130038.Text: I've got to get back to my research

201140000.Text: {NICKNAME}, you often test the Simulated Universe for Herta, don't you?

201140001.Text: Unfortunately, I'm not there right now

201140002.Text: I can make a trip there when I'm free. What's the matter?

201140003.Text: How serendipitous! I'm testing it now

201140004.Text: What can your "humble assistant" do for you?

201140005.Text: I lost a set of Ruan strings, which should be in Herta's office

201140006.Text: I've got a spare, so there's no rush

201140007.Text: If you happen to stumble on it, please bring it back for me. Thanks in advance

201140008.Text: If Herta asks anything, just tell her I got so mesmerized by her portrait that I forgot about the strings. She shouldn't probe any further

201140012.Text: Herta's beauty is unquestionable, just like her foul temper

201140013.Text: I can't help getting absorbed in the research results whenever I'm at the space station. If I leave something behind, that's the excuse I use, and it always works

201140014.Text: So you left behind other things before?

201140016.Text: A piece of embroidery, a lifeform nurturing notebook, and the Phase Flame of #29 Sserkal

201140017.Text: Embroidery... You like doing it in your free time, don't you?

201140018.Text: Yes. I made an embroidery of the Blue when I was nearby the railway platform

201140019.Text: It's still missing. Perhaps, some researcher picked it up

201140020.Text: I hope it's in the hands of someone who appreciates it

201140021.Text: Lifeform nurturing notebook? I think I've seen it somewhere...

201140022.Text: There are researchers who want to duplicate my creations. They do it by circulating poor imitations of my research formulae secretly

201140023.Text: However, the ingredients aren't the key when it comes to nurturing lifeforms

201140024.Text: The most important thing is the spark of inspiration when coming up with the formula

201140025.Text: Phase Flame? Is Herta aware of it?

201140026.Text: She is. It is just one of many in her collection

201140027.Text: She won't be bothered by it

You left behind other things before?

201150001.Text: Sure thing. What do you wanna chat about, Madam Xueyi?

201150002.Text: You seem to be free, which is great

201150003.Text: I thought you were a woman of few words, as you usually seem quite taciturn

201150005.Text: But I can talk just as normal

201150006.Text: Just finished a mission. Got a few perplexities, reckon I could inquire of thee?

201150007.Text: The Ten-Lords Commission was notified that someone had been flooding the internet with claims "I'm mara-struck"

201150008.Text: There were lots of posts like that

201150009.Text: It seemed to be a call for help

201150010.Text: So, I went and did some sleuthing

201150011.Text: The mara-struck claim isn't real, right?

201150013.Text: He doesn't even have any early symptoms of it

201150014.Text: I reckon it was just some internet shenanigans, right?

201150015.Text: Seems like you have crossed paths with many who are full of hot air

201150016.Text: He isn't mara-struck, and he doesn't even have any early symptoms of it.

201150017.Text: I have some free time now after making sure he's not mara-struck.

201150018.Text: So, why does he go around and tell everyone he is mara-struck? I'm baffled.

201150019.Text: Perhaps, by claiming so, he can use it as a get-out-of-jail-free card

201150020.Text: "Don't mess with me, because I'm mara-struck." Something like that

201150021.Text: I see. Now I get it

201150022.Text: In other words, he doesn't want to be responsible for his words and actions

201150023.Text: It could be just a self-deprecating and playful remark. I've seen similar ones

201150024.Text: "I could have become mara-struck without you!" Something like that

201150026.Text: Seems like I don't have a good sense of humor?

201150027.Text: To me, being mara-struck isn't something one should joke about

201150028.Text: Thank you. I've learned a lot from this conversation

Choices.Text: Was it just some internet shenanigans?
He is using it as a get-out-of-jail-free card
It could be just a playful remark

201160001.Text: Sure thing. What is it about, Madam Xueyi?

201160003.Text: Are you sure about that? My advice might not be advisable. Do take it with many a grain of salt

201160005.Text: You know my sister, Hanya, don't you? She works in the netherworld and is always on duty

201160006.Text: I'd like to send her a gift

201160007.Text: I'm not good at choosing gifts, so I'd like to ask for your advice

201160008.Text: Madam Hanya is very pretty. I'm sure you won't go wrong with getting her some nice clothing or beauty products

201160010.Text: But I'm bad at choosing such gifts

201160011.Text: You don't always have to send physical stuff. Sometimes, just a simple "thank you" will do

201160016.Text: But she doesn't need any more stationery or books

201160017.Text: If there's nothing special with the gift, I bet she'll just take it and put it aside

201160018.Text: Is there a more suitable gift for someone like my sister?

201160019.Text: This may sound a little abstract, but I think what Madam Hanya needs is time.

201160020.Text: This may sound a little abstract, but I think what Madam Hanya needs is company

201160021.Text: You can go shopping or watch an immersia with her. Spending time with her is your gift to her

201160025.Text: Huohuo's right to say that I need advice from someone mortal

201160027.Text: I meant to say someone who lives in the mortal world

201170004.Text: Madam Xueyi, what happened to you? What's going on?

201170006.Text: Please return the jade abacus you found to its owner  Madam Xueyi from the Ten-Lords Commission

201170010.Text: I'm just trying out the emoticons

201170012.Text: And even my text messages sound too serious

201170013.Text: Per her suggestion, I am now testing these emoticons

201170016.Text: Truth be told, I'm not quite used to it. This isn't the Madam Xueyi I'm familiar with.

201170018.Text: I don't think there's much difference.

201170020.Text: Before asking for my opinion, why don't you find out what you think of it yourself?

201170022.Text: I don't think there's much difference

201170024.Text: What about Huohuo, who made the suggestion? What does she think?

201170025.Text: She told me not to send these emoticons to anyone

201170026.Text: I don't think there's much difference

201170028.Text: This feels kind of odd, but I'm now fine with you using them

201170030.Text: Please stop using these emoticons. It's so not you

201170032.Text: I just copy and paste the emoticons I find interesting. Don't know what they mean

Please return the jade abacus to its owner
I'm not quite used to it

201180000.Text: <u>Tap to register for the [Rosetta-Rosenthal Cup]. We look forward to meeting you.</u>

201180002.Text: {NICKNAME}, I've sent you the info about the recent debate competition held within the guild. The debate topic is Are science and technology neutral?

201180003.Text: Don't get any wrong ideas. I'm simply forwarding someone else's post.

201180005.Text: I'm more than articulate to handle this

201180007.Text: There are no bounds in the art of language.

201180008.Text: But I know nothing about debate

201180009.Text: All the more reason for you to learn, then.

201180011.Text: Clearly, you don't know yourself well enough.

201180012.Text: It matters not whether you join the competition.

201180013.Text: But I am inclined to acquire an understanding of how you perceive debate as an activity within your cognitive framework.

201180014.Text: Debate is about arguing against the other side

201180015.Text: Debate is about triggering the other side

201180016.Text: Debate is about being snarky with each other

201180017.Text: Very well, then. Allow me to expound on this topic using the proposition above as an example, if you please.

201180020.Text: I'll take the opposite side then. You may speak first.

201180021.Text: Technology is a double-edged sword, in the sense that it can be used to do both good and evil.

201180022.Text: Have you ever heard of Dr. Primitive's atavistic experiment?

201180023.Text: To induce a stress response in his subjects, he developed a series of technologies with the sole purpose to torture and inflict sufferings.

201180026.Text: I'll take the affirmative side then. You may speak first.

201180027.Text: Some technologies are inherently good, like those that prolong lifespans.

201180028.Text: Indeed, strides made in medical technologies have, undeniably, saved many a soul from afflictions and ailments. But medical treatments are not necessarily synonymous with prolongation of life.

201180029.Text: Haven't you lot visited the Xianzhou Alliance already? Methinks you ought to have a keener understanding of the dear price one must pay for immortality.

201180031.Text: See, this verily confirms my assertion.

201180032.Text: I didn't even get to speak!

201180033.Text: Most often, one's rapid elocution bespeaks an agile intellect.

201180034.Text: However, it may also indicate a complete lack of cerebral engagement in one's discourse.

201180036.Text: You'll have lost the game, if that is your argument.

201180037.Text: But there is a certain truth in what you say.

201180038.Text: Indeed, the conclusion is plain to see. Neither of us can sway the assertion of the other.

201180039.Text: You get it now? The truth, at times, does shine brighter and clearer via this manner of discourse, and at other times, it doesn't.

201180040.Text: Most debates often amount to nothing more than a frivolous play of words.

201180041.Text: Amongst other things... I have once been enticed into partaking in debates that transcend the confines of language.

201180043.Text: Do bear in mind, {NICKNAME}, that a robust constitution always proves its mettle, no matter the hour.

Choices.Text: It's gonna be a cakewalk for me
It's humans that do good or evil
Technologies are either good or evil
I didn't even get to speak

201190000.Text: After three months of incessant engineering designs, I feel a tad weary.

201190001.Text: {NICKNAME}, do grace my intellect with a much-needed barrage of stimulating quizzes, if you would be so kind.

201190002.Text: This is the first time I've received a request like this.

201190004.Text: Is this not how you usually unwind?

201190005.Text: Please design a weapon for the Express.

201190007.Text: Here. It's an anti-planetary weapon design that I once devised, perfectly suited for the Express.

201190008.Text: Whilst traversing the cosmos, high-caliber armaments are an indispensable necessity.

201190010.Text: The Express itself is the weapon.

201190011.Text: The Express, a mere assemblage of carriages, becomes a colossal weapon when fitted with lightweight yet resilient materials, all without compromising its internal architecture.

201190012.Text: The blueprint delineates the potential for it to morph into a humanoid assault weapon, enabling you to engage in combat without budging an inch.

201190013.Text: Where can I get the materials you mentioned?

201190014.Text: Someone in the guild is spearheading the development of such materials. Expect fruitful outcomes within the next five Amber Eras.

201190015.Text: Well, are you up for a collaboration?

201190016.Text: How to turn the Express into a perpetual motion machine that doesn't rely on external energy?

201190017.Text: That's a brilliant question. Let me see.

201190019.Text: As it happens, the question of energy has been an old friend of mine.

201190020.Text: I am confident in my ability to elevate the train to a level approaching perpetual motion.

201190024.Text: I've just perused the Guild's compendium on the Express and looked into its architectural intricacies and energy consumption.

201190025.Text: From the records, I notice that refueling for the Express has been dreadfully irregular since its recommencement, yet it manages to keep warping, virtually unperturbed.

201190026.Text: In a sense, it is already a perpetual-motion machine.

201190027.Text: What power propels the Express to journey so enduringly, I wonder?

201190028.Text: One fine day, I shall personally dismantle it to seek its truth with my own hands.

201190029.Text: Don't let the conductor hear you. They can be terrifying when they get cranky.

201190030.Text: Ah, yes, that conductor, perhaps, holds the very key to this secret.

201190031.Text: One fine day, I shall unravel their enigma, too.

201190032.Text: I'll report these ideas of yours to the conductor.

Choices.Text: This is such a weird request.
Please design a weapon for the Express.
Don't let the conductor hear you.

201200000.Text: The esteemed University of Veritas Prime has once again commenced its enrollment proceedings. Do you, perchance, harbor aspirations for further refinements and scholarly pursuits?

201200002.Text: Interstellar voyages necessitate a wealth of erudition, lest one may very well perish amidst perils unknown.

201200003.Text: What subjects tickle your fancy? Mathematics, physics, or perhaps, philosophy...?

201200005.Text: Allow me to regale you with a tale.

201200006.Text: Once upon a time, a physicist and an engineer found themselves adrift in a hot air balloon amidst a ravine.

201200007.Text: They screamed at the top of their lungs, "Yo-ho! Where are we?"

201200008.Text: After fifteen minutes had elapsed, they heard a voice reply, "Yo-ho! You are in a hot air balloon!"

201200009.Text: The physicist deduced, "Surely, that must be a mathematician..."

201200010.Text: "...for he took an extensive period of time to produce an entirely accurate answer, albeit utterly inconsequential."

201200011.Text: Truth be told, mathematics is a formidable discipline, one that eludes the grasp of many throughout their lifetime, rendering its significance inscrutable.

201200012.Text: What a dry joke that is.

201200014.Text: Nowadays, physics journals are being published at a rate surpassing even the speed of light.

201200015.Text: This, however, does not defy the law of relativity, for all those journals carry not even an iota of meaningful information.

201200016.Text: Moreover, should you ever embark upon this line of academic endeavor, it is highly probable that a staggering four-fifths of the year shall be exclusively consumed by languid progression, while the remaining fifth shall be indubitably bereft of any semblance of progression at all.

201200019.Text: Are you privy to the demarcation between philosophy and science?

201200020.Text: To tackle scientific quandaries, one requires parchment, quill, and an eraser.

201200021.Text: Yet, to unravel philosophical enigmas, parchment and quill shall suffice.

201200022.Text: For in philosophy lies a notable lack of a definitive criterion for right and wrong.

201200023.Text: I would not recommend this discipline to neophytes.

201200025.Text: You may need more time for careful consideration.

201200026.Text: Beware of those who only extol the virtues of an academic discipline without candidly acknowledging its challenges.

201200027.Text: I have met numerous students brimming with enthusiasm, only to witness their eventual departure, ensconced in disillusionment and despondency.

201200028.Text: Hence, any academic decision should be approached with utmost caution.

201200029.Text: Though it may sound harsh, not everyone is suited for the scholarly pursuit.

201200030.Text: I'll give it more serious thoughts

201200031.Text: I'm surprised you're aware it sounds harsh

201200032.Text: Do ponder upon it with due diligence before tendering your response, and should you require it, I shall gladly lend my quill to pen a commendatory missive to your benefit.

Choices.Text: What a dry joke that is.
I'll give it more serious thoughts
I'm surprised you're aware it sounds harsh

201210000.Text: I am curious, {NICKNAME}. Having traveled to so many places, have you encountered divination before?

201210001.Text: The Xianzhou Luofu uses the Matrix of Prescience to make predictions about the future

201210002.Text: You mean the Divination Commission, right... I have heard tales of them before.

201210003.Text: I think the Stellaron Hunters have this ability, too.

201210004.Text: You mean that Destiny's Slave... Say no more.

201210005.Text: Everyone has their own beliefs when it comes to divination methods. If you ask me, I believe you can predict a person's future using only their memories.

201210006.Text: This method of divination is based on a law of life, that we are constantly living under the influence of our pasts.

201210007.Text: The deeper the memory is carved into someone's mind, the more complete and original it is, the clearer the trajectory of the destiny that leads from it.

201210008.Text: Well, would you like to try?

201210009.Text: There are lots of things that I do not remember...

201210010.Text: Yes, you and that March 7th are very special...

201210011.Text: As neither of you have any memories for me to divine from, why don't you take the lead and use this method to perform a divination using someone else's memories?

201210012.Text: There is a reason for every word we speak, you must simply just say what is in your heart.

201210013.Text: I shall describe a memory to you, you can make predictions about the future based on it as you please.

201210015.Text: Then I'm going to be bold and make some predictions!

201210017.Text: Then I'm going to be bold and make some predictions!

201210019.Text: "A young girl wanders alone, observing the influence that the past has had on the reality of different worlds and recording those fleeting moments that went overlooked."

201210020.Text: What kind of future do you think the owner of this memory is headed towards?

201210021.Text: Being able to roam alone throughout different worlds, she must be a considerably powerful person

201210022.Text: She enjoys observing the lives of others but is still able to leave without causing a disturbance. I imagine she is an attentive and optimistic person

201210023.Text: So, I imagine that she will live happily, no matter what happens

201210024.Text: If she spends the rest of her life as nothing more than an observer from the sidelines, I imagine her life will be very bland

201210025.Text: Perhaps she will continue like this until she reaches the end of her life, before leaving in silence with no one to remember her

201210026.Text: If she continues to wander the cosmos alone like this, she will inevitably encounter a lot of danger

201210027.Text: It is very likely that she will lose her life along this journey one day

201210028.Text: Also, if she spends her entire life as a bystander and observer, I imagine she will be very lonely

201210029.Text: I'm glad I was able to hear your thoughts. Not bad.

201210030.Text: Did that give you a sense of the power within memories? It leads to the future and allows us to catch a glimpse of the whole picture... However, keep in mind that the future can also change, never forget that.

201210031.Text: So, who is the owner of this memory? What is her future like?

201210032.Text: She may be someone you know, she may also just be a passing figure in your life.

201210033.Text: Ah, another customer for divination. Talk to you again, soon!

Choices.Text: The Stellaron Hunters use it, too.

201220000.Text: Having a chance to see the return of the Astral Express truly is a joyous thing.

201220001.Text: When going to other worlds, I always came across memories related to the Express. As time has gone on, I feel like we have become friends that have never met.

201220003.Text: I once visited a world that stood high up in the sky. The people of this world hid amongst the clouds, driving huge monsters to bring down the rainwater.

201220004.Text: In their legends, these huge monsters were brought there by a giant Nameless, allowing their local civilization to thrive.

201220005.Text: I also once visited a world that rained gems. The people of this world predict the weather, collect the gems and use them in trade with other worlds. Their legends also state that this was also a revelation brought about by a Nameless that traveled on the Express.

201220006.Text: Hearing all of these legends that sounded so unbelievable, I could not help but wonder what the life of a Nameless is truly like.

201220007.Text: Though I have not been to many worlds yet, the Nameless are indeed the kind of people that will assist those around them wherever they go

201220008.Text: But it's not as miraculous and astounding as these legends

201220009.Text: These legends are so magnificent, but our daily lives tend to be quite unremarkable most of the time

201220010.Text: However, the Nameless are indeed the kind of people that will assist those around them wherever they go

201220011.Text: It seems to be a path full of both challenges and rewards. I wonder what has allowed the Express and the Nameless to persist for all this time?

201220012.Text: We all practice the values of the Trailblaze, which is the Nameless' motivation to keep moving forwards

201220013.Text: It is likely the legacy passed down from generation to generation of Nameless. Though one Trailblazer is lost, the embers they leave behind are passed down to ignite the passion of the next generation.

201220014.Text: I imagine it is the amazing opportunities offered up by the Express. As long as one is willing to set forth together on an adventure, the Express's doors will freely open to them.

201220015.Text: Our path is unlike that which you have chosen with the Express, as you advance to distant lands, we spend our time seeking the past. You form a bond and travel together, where we often journey alone.

201220016.Text: However, in this vast existence, the footprints of both Memokeepers and Nameless often overlap. Perhaps we shall meet each other at our final destination.

201220017.Text: What is the life of a Memokeeper like?

201220018.Text: Memokeepers live a memetic existence, traveling through worlds through the medium of concepts and memories.

201220019.Text: Like a passing visitor in the lives of others, I do not often get involved in the worlds I visit as all we care for are the memories contained within.

201220020.Text: Travelling through concepts, that sounds so cool!

201220021.Text: Indeed, entering another's memory is like walking into a whole new world.

201220023.Text: Memories are the most precious when they have not been interfered with by others.

201220024.Text: In the future, if you come across any interesting stories, don't forget to come and share them with me.

201230000.Text: Come to think of it, did you know that memories related to the sense of smell are some of the strongest and most vivid in humans?

201230001.Text: I feel like I've heard that theory before

201230003.Text: Hm? What made you bring that up all of a sudden?

201230004.Text: You see, it's just that I used up all the pine incense I use during divination and a perfumer friend gave me a new box. When I lit it, I realized that the aroma seemed very familiar.

201230005.Text: Reflecting on my memories, I realized that it must be very similar to the essence of the Trailblaze.

201230006.Text: I never thought you'd know about things like aromatherapy

201230007.Text: As I said before, memories related to the sense of smell are some of the strongest in humans.

201230008.Text: So, certain aromas often come with set memories. Even a Memokeeper like myself sometimes enjoys using these kinds of indirect methods to recall those memories.

201230009.Text: Next time we meet, I shall bring some of the styles I enjoy for you to experience, too.

Choices.Text: Why did you bring that up?

201240000.Text: An old friend has sent you a message request.

201240002.Text: Warning! This account has been reported by multiple users. You and this user currently have no mutual friends, please be cautious during your interaction.

201240004.Text: I'm your old friend, I hear you're in Penacony too? Fancy meeting up?

201240007.Text: I know you're busy, but I need your help with something

201240009.Text: Ah, sorry! I think I got the wrong person

201240011.Text: Have you heard about the Charmony Festival? There's going to be a performance by Robin, a singer known across the cosmos!

201240012.Text: I have a ticket, I'm not buying one

201240013.Text: Ah, how did you know I had extra tickets?

201240014.Text: I should have expected this from you. These tickets are almost impossible to get hold of, I never imagined that you would have managed to grab one

201240015.Text: If you don't have a ticket, you can buy one from me. I've got as many as you need

201240016.Text: Are you serious...? These tickets are almost impossible to get hold of, how did you manage to bag so many? You didn't do anything illegal, did you?

201240017.Text: Looks like the market isn't looking great at the moment, I just can't sell these tickets. Fortunately, that wasn't the business I was calling you about

201240018.Text: Robin had two backing performers that had to drop out due to sickness, I received a quota to fill in and thought of you straight away

201240019.Text: I can teach you the steps and you can just head straight out on stage

201240022.Text: <u>Don't miss out! Click this link to register your number and appear on stage with Robin</u>

201240023.Text: Click this link and enter your personal details as well as your address

201240024.Text: Remember to upload a front-on photo of yourself. It has to be front-facing! Even better if you can do a 360-degree shot!

201240025.Text: Show me once you've uploaded it!

201240026.Text: It will help you pass through facial recognition

201240027.Text: Warning! Please do not use external chat applications to complete transactions to avoid the risk of scams and fraudulent activity!

201240034.Text: Thanks, I'm not interested in scams

201240035.Text: Hey, don't just leave me hanging! It's really simple!

201240036.Text: <u>Don't miss out! Click this link to register your number and appear on stage with Robin</u>

201240037.Text: Click this link and enter your personal details as well as your address

201240038.Text: Oh yeah, remember to upload a front-on photo of yourself. It has to be front-facing! Even better if you can do a 360-degree shot!

201240039.Text: Show me once you've uploaded it!

201240040.Text: It will help you pass through facial recognition

201240041.Text: Warning! Please do not use external chat applications to complete transactions to avoid the risk of scams and fraudulent activity!

201240042.Text: You know what? I'll put my faith in my old friend

201240043.Text: I've signed up! Here's the picture!

201240049.Text: You've been spamming too much. The system is sending out scam warnings...

201240051.Text: No way! I didn't get them on my end!

201240053.Text: These system warnings are so annoying!

201240054.Text: What's wrong with reaching out to an old friend to get back in touch?

201240055.Text: Fine! Forget it. I'll come back with something fun for you next time!

201240056.Text: Bring it on, we'll see who tricks whom next time!

201240057.Text: Please don't come back! Nothing good ever comes from hanging about with a Fool...

201240059.Text: This account is no longer available due to multiple reports by other users.

201240061.Text: What? I can't text you just because I haven't met you?

Choices.Text: You want to buy a ticket?

201250000.Text: Pom-Pom has sent you a message request.

201250002.Text: Pom-Pom noticed something weird's gotten onto the Express!!!

201250003.Text: So, Pom-Pom chased it into the engine room!!!

201250007.Text: What are you talking about? Pom-Pom is Pom-Pom, conductor of the Express!!!

201250009.Text: Pom-Pom broke the comms device during Pom-Pom's routine inspection, so Pom-Pom had to change to a temporary account of Pom-Pom's!!!

201250010.Text: I still suspect that you are Sparkle

201250012.Text: You're spamming way too many Pom-Poms than the normal level!

201250014.Text: My plan of being loyal to the character ended up backfiring, my mistake...

201250015.Text: Pom-Pom would punish anyone that breaks into the engine room!

201250017.Text: I didn't realize that little plush was so dangerous. That's pretty cool...

201250018.Text: No one can infiltrate the Express apart from Nameless and guests who have been explicitly invited!

201250020.Text: I don't believe that. There are quite a number of hitchhikers that have successfully made it onboard

201250021.Text: You think there is no Masked Fool among them?

201250022.Text: It's you! The great Express conductor!

201250023.Text: Now you're using a suspicious temporary account, it means the cat is finally out of the bag!

201250025.Text: Sorry... But I have always known your secret... the secret of the Express...

201250027.Text: What is hidden in the engine room is actually...

201250031.Text: You Astral Express people would go that far?

201250032.Text: You, the Express conductor, are actually a Masked Fool

201250035.Text: Huh? How come I didn't know that?

201250036.Text: You Nameless would really go that far?

201250037.Text: Everyone on the Express was created by the Express' conductor!

201250040.Text: Huh? Even I wouldn't make something like that up

201250041.Text: Seriously, my friend, you've gone too far!

201250043.Text: Ah, I really thought that was true... I dropped the act in the heat of the moment

201250044.Text: You're pretty bold to make up such a lie

201250045.Text: Being exposed so quickly is just embarrassing...

201250046.Text: I need to prepare properly for the next time we chat. I'll be back when I think of something good

201250047.Text: Bring it on, we'll see who tricks whom next time!

201250048.Text: Please don't come back! Nothing good ever comes from hanging about with a Fool...

201250050.Text: You're really starting to sound like a broken record with that term

201250051.Text: How can you call having fun "making trouble"?

201250052.Text: Have you never heard the phrase: "A bit of fun a day keeps the Masked Fool away?"

201250053.Text: Masked Fools prefer to stir up things in life that are inherently boring, making them more wonderful!

201250054.Text: Alright, I've got things to do. If you don't want me back, I won't come back

201250055.Text: Let me know next time if you have something fun coming up

Choices.Text: It's you! The great Express conductor!
No one can get inside the engine room!
No one can infiltrate the Express!
What is hidden in the engine room is actually...
The Express conductor is a Masked Fool

201260000.Text: Trashcan has sent you a message request.

201260005.Text: That's right, I am your favorite trashcan.

201260006.Text: Your fiery passion has ignited my trashie heart that has laid dormant for so long.

201260007.Text: Ignited? Seriously? You're saying I'm an incinerator?

201260008.Text: That's right! You've caused my frozen heart to burn and become the energy that drives me to continue living!

201260009.Text: A trashcan is messaging me to express their heartfelt feelings... What kind of plot is this?

201260010.Text: This is nothing to be surprised by, my brethren. Love can move mountains and fill the oceans. Love can transcend the borders between humans and trash.

201260011.Text: I am no longer just a regular trashcan.

201260012.Text: I am now a burning trashcan.

201260013.Text: Underneath my exterior as cold as steel... My heart burns brightly and brilliantly like fireworks.

201260014.Text: Sparkle, what are you playing at now?

201260015.Text: I am not a sparkle! I am just a...

201260016.Text: ...Trashcan that has a passion like fire!

201260017.Text: I cannot believe that you mistook me for someone else. This is heartbreaking. You are a horrible person!

201260018.Text: I no longer believe in love. Goodbye.

201260019.Text: I'm begging you. Try some better acting next time...

Choices.Text: What kind of plot is this?

201270000.Text: I want to buy a big storage chest

201270002.Text: Yeah! With the exploding cloud candies that the customer gave me yesterday, my drawers are already stuffed full of souvenirs from various planets...

201270003.Text: I split some into smaller portions. I'll bring you some when I see you next time!

201270004.Text: They taste a bit like a spicier version of mint, but the aftertaste is surprisingly fresh and sweet! This flavor matches the impression I get from that customer perfectly

201270005.Text: He was tall and strong with a ferocious expression and a great ax on his back. He looked a lot like Boss Stone

201270006.Text: I spent a lot of time preparing myself mentally before going to help him...

201270007.Text: A customer like that gifting you sweets. It's got a nice contrast to it

201270008.Text: It does. I was super cautious when I asked if he wanted help taking his luggage up! When I realized he was the silent type, I got even more scared and actually tripped over. When I climbed back to my feet, I realized that the customer had already taken his luggage and taken the lift upstairs...

201270009.Text: Thankfully I didn't make any mistakes when I went to clean his room and I even fixed his Dreamscape room clock. When I went back, he was not there, but he had left a pack of exploding cloud candy for me. I breathed huge a sigh of relief... That kind of recognition felt amazing!

201270010.Text: Do you think... if I keep working hard like this, I'll receive enough candies from guests to cover me for the rest of my life?

201270011.Text: Probably, but your teeth will rot! Kids should take better care of their teeth!

201270012.Text: I'm not a kid anymore! I may have had tooth decay before, but I've been careful ever since!

201270013.Text: Ah, I have to go and greet guests. Talk to you again soon!

201270016.Text: Hehe, hearing you say that makes me feel so proud! It's more that the guests put up with me, though

201270017.Text: Thank you for your approval though. I need to go and greet guests. Talk to you again soon!

Choices.Text: Yes, but your teeth will rot

201280000.Text: Are you there...? Excuse me, I wanted to ask if there are any recommendations for things I'll need for traveling?

201280001.Text: The Express has everything you need. You don't need to bring anything

201280002.Text: They even prepare a change of clothes? The Express really is the best!

201280003.Text: Although, hearing you say that makes me worry even more... Ah, what else do I need to take with me?

201280004.Text: Phone, credits, a baseball bat! They're all pretty practical, right?

201280005.Text: Yeah! Communications, currency, and an item for self-defense... are all absolute necessities!

201280006.Text: But these things aside, what else will I need...

201280007.Text: I finally got a short amount of vacation time, but I haven't even decided where I want to travel to!

201280008.Text: I want to prepare my luggage, then select my destination. Then, I can just set off right away!

201280009.Text: Would you like to come with us? We'll leave tomorrow!

201280010.Text: That's very tempting, but I only have three days... I don't think that's very suitable for long-distance travel

201280011.Text: You could actually spend your holiday in the hotel

201280012.Text: That's a really good idea... I may have worked here for a long time, but I've never enjoyed the hotel's services as a guest before!

201280013.Text: I just know there are lots of exciting things to explore. Just thinking about it makes me so happy!!!

201280014.Text: Are you not scared traveling alone? What if you run into bad people?

201280015.Text: I'm not scared! I decided I am going to learn from you, {NICKNAME}! I'm going to buy a baseball bat to protect myself!

201280017.Text: No matter where you are, pictures can always bring us closer together

201280019.Text: ...A solitary and frozen land... do these Snow Plains have a name? What planet are they on? Can you visit without an invitation?

201280020.Text: These Snow Plains are on the planet Jarilo-VI, outside the town of Belobog. You are free to go whenever you like

201280021.Text: Great. I have to go and see this place!

201280022.Text: Speaking with you makes me so happy! It feels like I've already started on my dream adventure. You have to tell me more next time!

Choices.Text: Would you like to come with us?
You could vacation in the hotel
Are you not scared traveling alone?
You can go whenever you like

201290004.Text: There's a huge shadow in the hotel...

201290005.Text: Where are you? I'll head over to you

201290007.Text: There's a huge shadow... It's getting closer

201290008.Text: Your friend Misha has gone offline

201290010.Text: I want to... But my legs have gone weak. I can't move...

201290011.Text: Your friend Misha has gone offline

201290013.Text: I was saved... I ran into the elevator and came down when it turned to go in a different direction

201290014.Text: Thank you. Your message comforted me a lot

201290015.Text: I'm just glad you're okay. Tell me more about this shadow

201290016.Text: I actually don't know much about it... I've heard before that there's a black shadow haunting the hotel at night, sometimes crying, sometimes laughing...

201290017.Text: Ah, what bad luck... At least I managed to get away! I heard that one of my brave co-workers came across it last night and then...

201290018.Text: And then... Are they still alive?

201290020.Text: They are! It's just that when the shadow passed them, all of the lights in the corridor suddenly went out! Before they did... he saw a grimacing shadow...

201290021.Text: Did they give the shadow a good beating?

201290022.Text: My colleague was getting ready for a fight, but all of the lights in the corridor suddenly went out! Before they did... he saw a grimacing shadow...

201290023.Text: No need to thank me, I've seen it before, too

201290024.Text: Actually, it is not {NICKNAME} that is speaking with you now, it is me...

201290025.Text: You never would have guessed, would you? I have already devoured your friend...

201290028.Text: *cough* It's a joke! Of course it's not real!

201290029.Text: Your friend Misha has gone offline

201290032.Text: You scared me silly! I'm so glad you're okay! I was just looking for a way to rescue you!

201290033.Text: Wait! A grimacing shadow... Crying... It's back...

201290034.Text: I'll use my broom as a baseball bat... It should work just as well, right?

Choices.Text: Where are you? I'll head over
Did they beat up the shadow?

201300000.Text: Wanna try the new mix I have? I call it the "Vaporizer"

201300001.Text: Will it vaporize me on the spot if I try it?

201300002.Text: Just one sip of the drink and you get vaporized on the spot? Nah, I can't pull off something like that.

201300003.Text: But the taste and texture won't let you down

201300004.Text: "Vaporizer." Sounds like a drink that doesn't exist

201300005.Text: You know, the way you're describing it actually kinda fits

201300007.Text: So, what, I'm going to be drinking air???

201300008.Text: Hey, scamming guests isn't my style

201300009.Text: In Penacony, you can find all kinds of drink-mixing ingredients, and sometimes, the flavor that comes out of the mix is hard to describe

201300010.Text: I don't know how many "unique" drinks I've tasted before the "Vaporizer" was created

201300011.Text: Please tell me about some of these unique flavors

201300012.Text: There are way too many examples

201300013.Text: Among recent mixes, "Feast and Exile" and "Masked Talent" can be considered classics. They left me with the deepest impressions

201300015.Text: I wanted to mix something lustrous but didn't expect the industrial-grade syrup to be so sweet, dominating all other flavors entirely

201300016.Text: To rectify that, I added a bit of "bitterness"

201300017.Text: But I totally didn't expect the supplemental flavors to be that intense... One bite and my old hound soul almost got lost in the utter bitterness

201300019.Text: The original point of the mix was to let people find a bit of sour and sweet amidst the cold shaved ice

201300020.Text: Like finding candy among glass shards?

201300021.Text: Kinda, but after it went down, it was like drinking a cup of cold water. Nothing sour at all. Boring

201300022.Text: Comparatively, the "Vaporizer" is doing something really impressive

201300023.Text: Using SoulGlad as a foundation, and imbued with "Atmo-Sweet" and "Recollection" as supporting ingredients

201300024.Text: The incongruity woven from both sweet and bitter when you take one sip. It's like you're tasting life itself

201300025.Text: Every time you try to reminisce and grasp onto something, you're only left with fleeting nothingness

201300026.Text: Alright, I'll be there to have a taste of "life"!

201300028.Text: This just like me fr! Do I even need to make a special trip for this drink

201300029.Text: Trust me this once. You won't be disappointed

Choices.Text: Will it vaporize me on the spot if I try it?
Sounds like a drink that doesn't exist
Tell me about these unique flavors

201310004.Text: Scuse me. Phone's got a good stomping by my peg

201310009.Text: Your friend Gallagher has gone offline

201310010.Text: Your friend Gallagher has come online

201310011.Text: Right. Should be fine now. It's just that this new pet's been giving me some trumball

201310017.Text: My phone can be figgsed, but the pet I saved off the street's gotta be taken care of. No matter what

201310018.Text: I wanna see what kind of pet can break a phone like this...

201310020.Text: ...Agh. The phone's xamera fuktion is damaged too. The pet... is sorta a big one. Quite active but sampole-minded. Just think of it as a robo-dog

201310021.Text: If it can break your phone that badly, it might just be pretty smart

201310022.Text: Bitin the couucth, smashin up the newly mixed dringgs, usin my ties as a tooth grindr... After a few days of that, I'm pretty much used to these things

201310023.Text: It's a big 'un. But sampole-middded. Just think of it as a robo-dog

201310024.Text: Can't quite recall the exact date. I was out doin patrol round the streets when I stumbled upon it in this dodgy ol' alley. It was brawling with a few other dogs.

201310025.Text: I ain't usually one to meddle in these affairs. Fights over turf and whatnot, they're just way too common

201310026.Text: But then I saw it keep going. Throwing itself forward and struggling on the brink of death over and over without giving up. In the end, it won, but was wounded all over, so I figured why not. Took it back to the lounge and fixed it up

201310027.Text: Sounds like a movie script starring a robotic dog

201310028.Text: If a movie studio's interested, this guy might be turning in a mega-strrr real soon

201310029.Text: Aside from being a bit of a troublemaker, its pretty clever about stuff. Doesn't matter if it's learning to bite or heeding commands

201310030.Text: Right, I've been trying to come up with a name for this one. I've been calling it "hey, you" constantly and sometimes it deliberately ignores me

201310031.Text: Bingo! Because it can learn anything! Whether it's stuff that should be learned or not

201310032.Text: Yeah. That name does suit it pretty weil. Let's use that

201310033.Text: Pika! Like the sound of Pika White Grape Soda! People will know it's your dog immediately

201310034.Text: That's a pretty unique name! I like it. I'll use it

201310037.Text: Looks like there's nothing suitable... I'll just call it that for now

201310038.Text: Thanks for your help with the naming. I'll take a picture of it once I figgs my phone

201320001.Text: Don't sigh. It makes you sound old

201320002.Text: I doubt it. This hound's already gray

201320007.Text: I was just worried that you're in a bad mood

201320008.Text: Actually, I just saw another patron who made me a bit sentimental

201320009.Text: He is someone whose thoughts are always concerned with reality but is determined to live out the rest of his life in the dreamscape

201320010.Text: There are so many of them here in Penacony

201320011.Text: Maybe reality is too harsh, so he'd rather stay inside the dream

201320012.Text: Yes. He suffers from a terminal condition of no known cause. His body would slowly become uncontrollable, turning stiff and painful, until he can't even move his finger

201320013.Text: Unless his brain completely dies, otherwise...

201320014.Text: Would such suffering disappear in the dream?

201320015.Text: Yes. Not only that, he would be able to earn enough money for his treatment and life extension in this way

201320016.Text: He chose his life. I guess it counts as one way of living

201320017.Text: Yes. For someone who suffers terminal illness, choosing the dreamscape can be a form of rebirth

201320018.Text: On the flip side... Even though the dreamscape can shield him from the sensory aspects of reality and temporarily remove him from physical pain, the longing for his loved ones in the real world and the anxiety of facing a lonely death remain genuine sources of mental anguish

201320019.Text: If we pin everything on illness, then the existence of sweet dreams can indeed be a cure

201320020.Text: However, if dreams shatter one day, where would these people go, when they are already running away from troubles of their real life?

201320021.Text: This sure is deep... My brain hurts

201320022.Text: Haha, that's the charm of a midnight tavern

201320023.Text: Burrow into any corner and listen, and all you'll hear are the unfathomable joys of reunion and aches of parting

201320024.Text: There's always a way. We'll cross that bridge when we get to it

201320025.Text: Hehe, true. Life is full of possibilities. Let those who should worry, worry

201320026.Text: You seem to have a lot to say today

201340003.Text: Glad to see you're safe and sound

201340006.Text: Long story. Let's save it for next time

201340007.Text: Rest in peace! Guess it's over at last

201340008.Text: Haha, this sounds more like you!

201340009.Text: Since we've got nothing else going on, how about we play a simple dice game to keep our senses sharp?

201340010.Text: If the number you roll is greater than or equal to mine, I'll tell you something that happened after the theme park incident

201340014.Text: Your turn. Your chances seem good

201340017.Text: How about one more round? Nothing in the rules says we can't have a do-over

201340025.Text: After taking that one strike from that Emanator's blade, I waded into a river wider than any I've seen in my life

201340026.Text: I thought I had reached the end of my life

201340027.Text: But... as you can see, I'm still alive, and I'm happy about that

201340033.Text: This is surely a win, right?

201340036.Text: When you guys were unraveling the secrets beneath the Penacony's surface, I already fell into the Primordial Dreamscape. The Preservation's Cornerstone shielded me from the contamination of the Nihility, but in doing so, it completely shattered to smithereens.

201340037.Text: Fortunately, I met a Knight of Beauty and narrowly escaped death with his help.

201340039.Text: It's your turn. We gotta follow through with this game

201340046.Text: Then, thanks to you lot, all the truths came to light. Topaz and Jade took over the affairs on Penacony, and now I get to enjoy some time off

201340047.Text: But I've been having various nightmares these past few days, waking up drenched in sweat every single time

201340048.Text: Thankfully, the IPC has arranged for a Doctor of Chaos to give me a thorough examination, and things have improved

201340049.Text: That's about it. You're really lucky to get me to tell the whole story

201340050.Text: I knew you were losing on purpose from the get-go. There's no way you're that unlucky

201340051.Text: Happy losing, huh? You've tricked me again

201340052.Text: The Dreamscape may be a bustling place, but there aren't many 'friends'. I gotta find ways to make do, wouldn't you say?

201340053.Text: Thanks for helping me through the tough times. Hope I wasn't a bother

201340055.Text: Oh, that's too bad, I thought you'd like it.

201340056.Text: Never mind, it's not that important anyway

201340057.Text: Guess I'll find fun somewhere else, see ya

201350000.Text: Hey, friend. How's life treating you lately?

201350001.Text: There's a new store that opened up on Penacony  Cosmic Star. I'm checking the place out

201350003.Text: Oh? Are you getting me something?

201350004.Text: First, let's see if there's something that tickles your fancy

201350005.Text: Cosmic Star houses treasures from all over the universe. Every item is crafted by top-notch designers

201350006.Text: Most importantly, the items are of excellent quality and made of fine materials. They are nothing like the luxury goods that are all show and no substance

201350007.Text: For example, this "Horizon" series pajama is made with a material so light it feels like nothing, warm in winter, cool in summer, and extremely comfortable

201350008.Text: Wearing it to sleep should considerably lessen the fatigue from travel

201350009.Text: Take, for another example, these "Night Diamond" series gloves, the last masterpiece by the deceased design master Van Jagh. They're handcrafted and limited to ninety pairs galaxy-wide, perfect for parties and special occasions.

201350010.Text: Of course, they are highly recommended for long-distance trips too. They are gorgeous and are sure to turn heads!

201350011.Text: And then there's this windbreaker from the "Unmanned Flight" series  a timeless classic!

201350012.Text: You can wear it and stand on the edge of a cliff, listening to the flapping of its hem when the cosmic storm hits... It's because of that scene in the movie, "Unmanned Flight" has now become the go-to choice for a generation of the Nameless and their followers.

201350014.Text: I'm heading to the checkout now, so I'll pick up your stuff and pay together

201350018.Text: I'll have them deliver it to you

201350019.Text: In the long cosmic nights, may your every dream be sweet and fancy

201350022.Text: I'll have them deliver it to you

201350023.Text: I hope they make everyone envious of you

201350026.Text: I'll have them deliver it to you

201350027.Text: I'm sure you'll look cool in it. Remember to take a picture for me!

201350029.Text: Cool! That's what friends are for!

201350031.Text: They will all come in handy during your many travels

201350032.Text: No thanks. I'm not interested in any of them

201350033.Text: What a pity... but I've already bought them all

201350034.Text: If you change your mind, just let me know anytime

201350035.Text: Are they related to me? They aren't my cup of tea at all

201360002.Text: Pretty good. How about you? Been busy?

201360004.Text: Just listened to a blues instrumental called 'Flowerwild.' It's perfect for playing on the Express to help relax. Sharing it with you, hope you like it.

201360005.Text: Wow! A message from a superstar! I'm truly honored!

201360007.Text: I'll take that as a joke. There's no need for us to be so formal with each other, right?

201360008.Text: Just listened to a blues instrumental called 'Flowerwild.' It's perfect for playing on the Express to help relax. Sharing it with you, hope you like it.

201360011.Text: If you listen closely to this piece, it's as if you're amidst a sea of flowers... with windmills turning in the distance and sunlight casting over a maiden's skirt. Truly wondrous

201360013.Text: The Phonograph on the Express has played the song before. The conductor said they caught the scent of flowers after listening to it!

201360014.Text: That's right! I feel the same way

201360015.Text: Listen closely to this piece, and it's as if you're amidst a sea of flowers... with windmills turning in the distance and sunlight casting over a maiden's skirt. Truly wondrous

201360016.Text: Your songs are great too. There's something inspiring about them

201360017.Text: Thank you! Actually... I often struggle with how to convey my truest emotions to the audience when singing

201360018.Text: Hearing you say that puts me at ease. I'll keep pushing forward

201360019.Text: Love the music! Please keep the recommendations coming

201360021.Text: Next time I come across some good music, I'll make sure to share it with you

201360022.Text: I'm eager to give songwriting a shot as well!

201360024.Text: No problem! We can do it together if you don't mind

201360025.Text: By the way, there's something important I need to tell you... It might come as a surprise to you

201360027.Text: The location of my upcoming concert isn't far from Penacony, so I took the liberty of having the butler send some VIP concert tickets to the Express Crew...

201360028.Text: Because of my tight rehearsal schedule, I didn't give you a heads-up beforehand. Please forgive me

201360029.Text: Thanks, Miss Robin! I wouldn't mind at all!

201360030.Text: Thanks, Miss Robin! I'll make time for it!

201360031.Text: Thanks, Miss Robin! Now everyone's going to be too excited to sleep!

201360032.Text: I'll be looking forward to seeing you when I'm onstage

201370000.Text: {NICKNAME}, do you think... a bird with broken wings still has a chance to fly?

201370001.Text: There's hope as long as it's alive

201370003.Text: I saw a little bird with one of its wings broken on the panorama floor a few days ago. My heart went out to it

201370004.Text: I brought it back home, hoping it would make a fast recovery

201370005.Text: It's hard to say. I need to look at it in more detail

201370006.Text: Is that so... You are not wrong to think that way. After all, fate isn't predetermined, and a brief occurrence doesn't shape the future

201370008.Text: I saw a little bird with a broken wing on the panorama floor a few days ago. My heart went out to it

201370009.Text: I brought it back home, hoping it would make a fast recovery

201370010.Text: Has my brother told you the story of a little Charmony Dove?

201370011.Text: That poor Charmony Dove formed a big part of our childhood and taught us about "making choices" for the first time

201370012.Text: I remember the story. It's a tragic one

201370013.Text: I have no recollection of it whatsoever

201370015.Text: Looking back now, I realize we only gave it the right to live when we were little, but we had no clue how to ensure its survival thereafter

201370016.Text: But then again, who can truly define the rules of life?

201370017.Text: Compared to the Charmony Dove which had to learn how to fly from scratch, this little bird is luckier

201370019.Text: Your friend Robin has gone offline

201370021.Text: Did something happen to the little bird?

201370022.Text: Please get back to me! I'm begging you

201370023.Text: Your friend Robin has come online

201370024.Text: So sorry about that! I was so excited when I saw the little bird flap its wings just now, so I immediately rushed over and observed it for a while

201370025.Text: Seeing the little bird get better gradually fills me with joy

201370026.Text: It feels like I've resolved a regret from my childhood

201370027.Text: I'll remember this day! Truly a memorable one

201370028.Text: Thank you! Without your encouraging words, I'm afraid I would have stopped believing in the little bird's recovery already

201370029.Text: The bird seems happy too. Perhaps, it has its own wishes too

201370030.Text: Indeed, I hope the little bird can fly high again. Thanks for your words of encouragement, {NICKNAME}

201370031.Text: I've got to go take care of this little bird now

201370032.Text: Just wait for my good news~

Choices.Text: There's hope as long as it's alive

201380000.Text: I discovered a fascinating accessory shop! Ice cream necklaces, raccoon brooches, sunflower glasses, and monster hairclips~

201380001.Text: There are tons of adorable items, some of which are perfect for the Express Crew. If possible... I'd love to pick some for you all

201380005.Text: No worries. These accessories are all unique and make perfect gifts

201380006.Text: Save the cutest one for Mr. Yang!

201380007.Text: So Mr. Yang's into cutey stuff deep down, huh?

201380008.Text: I have a rough idea of what to pick now!

201380009.Text: A baseball bat cheering stick, a clover leaf hairpin with lights, a book-shaped storage box, a mini chef's hat, a vintage paper handbag, and a Clockie mech badge.

201380010.Text: {NICKNAME}, what do you think of these?

201380011.Text: Trust me, everyone's going to love them!

201380012.Text: Seems like I know a thing or two about the Express Crew now!

201380016.Text: During your time on Penacony, Miss March once told me about your conductor. She said the conductor always kept the Express in good order

201380017.Text: Most importantly, the conductor can make incredibly tasty dishes and desserts. That's why it didn't take me long to choose the mini chef's hat for the conductor

201380018.Text: I'm surprised the store sells baseball bats

201380019.Text: Actually, I got the store owner to customize it for me

201380020.Text: When chatting and flipping through photos, we talked about baseball bats. He thought turning one into a cheer stick was a fun idea, so he agreed to help make one on the spot.

201380021.Text: I'm on my way to posting the gifts to you now. Remember to check your mail

Choices.Text: Save the cutest one for Mr. Yang!

201390000.Text: Well butter my fudge and call me a biscuit, I'm askin' ya somethin'. You got some fudgin' cotton in them ears, boy? I need that freighter's ID number, and unless ya want a lead headache, best hurry it up. Dagnabbit, you lil' forker, ya really think ya can fudgin' swing at me? You're cruisin' for a bruisin', ya dimwit, I swear I'll dog your cats so good today. [Noise detected, unable to identify]

201390003.Text: ? Why are you cussing outta nowhere

201390005.Text: Ah, ain't nothin'. Reckon my phone got triggered by mistake, them tight jeans, you know how it is. All's well, no harm done. Muddle-fudger, you're as stubborn as a mule, ain't ya? Go choke on some shirtballs, ya hear me? [Noise detected, unable to recognize]

201390007.Text: What in tarnation are ya? A dadgum fudgehead! Yer yappin' like you're callin' folks out, huh? Aight, aight, aight, been itchin' for a tussle, ya shirt-for-brains. Fine, I'll show ya somethin' big, lil' forkers. Hahahahahahahaha [Noise detected, unable to recognize]

201390009.Text: Got it. You're doing a livestream, aren't you?

201390010.Text: I'll tip you 50 cents if you can drop some more dope lines

201390012.Text: Just get a new pair of jeans, bro. Or a new phone

201390014.Text: Aw shucks, ma bad. Apologies. Was just chattin' with a pal. Nothing to see here. Mighty sorry 'bout that. Later I'll rob a new phone real quick... Um, I mean "buy" a new phone. Hopefully, that'll fix things up, hahaha.

201390016.Text: Ahem, I know your whole deal is basically being an outlaw

201390017.Text: But it's probably better to pay for a new phone

201390018.Text: Well, shoot, who's talkin' 'bout robbin'? You heard wrong, haha. Gonna buy it fair and square, can't do it any other way.

201390020.Text: Why do you always send voice messages?

201390021.Text: I'm a very shy introvert. Can't handle people yapping at me

201390022.Text: Well, it's just, uh, you know. Didn't hit the books much when I was knee-high to a grasshopper, so, well, yappin' in voice messages comes easier, haha. Don't you be followin' my trail now, ya hear? Gotta hold them reins tight on yer own life.

201390024.Text: Gotta cut this short, pardner. I'm off to hunt some varmints, busy as a bee. I mean, catchin' up with "an old friend," it's been ages, haha. Till we meet again, adios.

Choices.Text: Please abide by the law for once

201400004.Text: Say something, or I'm giving up on you

201400006.Text: Haha, no sirree. I'm campin' near the lonesome stretches of the Kata Desert. When night falls quiet, you can hear the wind, the critters chirpin', and the rustle of wild beasts clear as a bell. Got a nice feel to it, so I reckoned I'd capture a bit of that and shoot it your way to have a listen.

201400008.Text: Too bad my stupid phone has such a fudgin' poor recording function. Boy, what a waste. Tell you what, the vibe here is really something. Forkin' awesome. Seriously.

201400010.Text: I've had enough. Send me the coordinates. I'll teleport there right away

201400011.Text: Ha, well ain't that a hoot. Too bad I've scoped it out, 'round these parts ain't no sign of y'all's Nameless shenanigans What's it called? Space Encore? Nope, Space Anchor! It's no man's land here, ya catch my drift?

201400013.Text: Sounds so enjoyable. I'm green with envy

201400014.Text: Ha, true enough. If you're cut out for this kind of life, then it sure is snug as a bug. Ain't kiddin', these sorts of camps ain't easy to stumble upon. Luck's on my side today, mighty comfortable.

201400016.Text: Holy forkeroni, this weather, it's downright beautiful. These stars, like flour sprinkled on a coat. Tsk, mighty pretty, truly fine. Far from home, seldom see stars like these. Real pretty sight, tsk tsk.

201400018.Text: Well, I'll be forked. Suddenly got a hankerin' for home, forkin' hell.

201400022.Text: My home, ha. Long gone, yep. Long gone. Ain't much to say 'bout that.

201400024.Text: Boys can cry too, you know, crying isn't a crime

201400025.Text: Just don't send me a voice message of it

201400026.Text: Ain't near 'bout bawlin' my eyes out. I reckon I don't even have that function no more. Means, I can't cry no more. Missing home, well, that's as common as dirt, ha.

201400028.Text: Shame though, real fudgin' shame. My old homestead's grasslands, not to boast, but lying there was heaven on earth. Not even the top-notch steer in camp could match that grass for comfort. A real pity, that. And that creek, clean as a whistle, I tell ya. Them little fish in it looked like they were just floating in the air, no foolin'.

201400030.Text: Come nightfall, you'd plop down in the grasslands, find yerself a rock, face the breeze and strum a guitar or wail on a harmonica  that's the slice of paradise, crisp and sweet. Darn shame, no chance for that no more. Tut-tut, can't go back no more. Cannot go back anymore.

201400032.Text: When the time comes, I'll show ya what I got, haha. Ain't no boastin', but in the whole camp, I strum the guitar finest. Harmonica too, true story, no fibbin'. Ah, the moon's dip'n low. Time I hit the trail, catch ya later. Thanks for chewin' the fat with me, much obliged.

Choices.Text: Cry if you feel like it.

201410000.Text: Hey, {NICKNAME}. I rustled up some goods, you interested?

201410002.Text: Lemme tell ya, it's mighty fine, lit as fudge. Just crackin' open the pack, the scent hits yer noggin straight away. Then ya start droolin' like a hound, ya catch my drift. Just a whiff's enough to make ya giddy on cloud nine, taste it, and you're shootin' straight to the moon, hahahaha.

201410004.Text: Sounds fishy. What sorta stuff is that?

201410005.Text: Where did you get it from?

201410006.Text: Don't go prying. Just know that it took me a heap of elbow grease. Fork it, ya've no idea how many sons of benches have been eyein' this, but today, I finally snagged it. Later, I'll have those lil' forkers hammer away at it, then seal it in a barrel and bury it deep for fermentin', else the purity would never fudgin' cut it. This here's some fine goods, can't let it be squandered on them shirt-for-brains, heh heh heh

201410008.Text: Where did you get these goodies!? Hand them over now!

201410009.Text: This is too suspicious. Get rid of them, now!

201410010.Text: Fudge, I'll be hornswoggled. What in tarnation do I gain from givin' it to ya, huh? Have I got bats in my belfry or what? You takin' me for a born fool? Heh, I forkin' reckon not!

201410014.Text: You fudgin' threatenin' me, pardner? Pullin' this stunt, huh? Well, shirt, I be forked. Aight, aight, you've got spunk, I like that. A ranger oughta shoot straight, not dilly-dally with all that fudgin' horsefeathers, hahahaha.

201410016.Text: Alrighty, it's yers. Shucks. Be here sharp at three system hours tonight, just you, nobody else. I'll shoot ya the coordinates later.

201410018.Text: Don't you dare waste it, y'hear, or we're gonna have words. This here's malt juice squeezed from premium Lufur watermelon, and in an entire Amber Era, ya be lucky to harvest two yields at best. Don't go wastin' it now. Saved myself just one bottle. Not a drop to spare, you got me? Ugh, shucks.

201430032.Text: Are the Stellaron Hunters still hiring?
